tI3JdhukpmHMa-duAq7-tQ.text: This place is to die for! Best bbq I have tasted out here in AZ. The service is great and the actual restaurant is so cool!! I'll be headed back there for sure. Absolutely delicious.

GGh1FtoWb4O7LumBEoK8Tw.text: I like Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ. I like the rustic decor. I like the menu. I like the friendly staff. I like the televisions. I know that the area consensus is that neighboring Rudy's BBQ is the better choice, and that may be so, but Can't Stop Smokin' is a solid alternative when the lines are out the door at Rudy's. The food, from meats to sides to sauce, is consistently good, but far from the best BBQ restaurant fare I've ever experienced. Ordering is a little confusing the first time in. Just grab a metal tray and wait your turn. Some young guys with very sharp knives will walk you through it.

LGWE2y_Sqn55xGYjZIYasg.text: Great food and service! Brisket and tritip are delicious. Staff is always kind and helpful. Definitely recommend!!

0bxk-krP8fjWqogA4s9Ymg.text: Came once and it was great in January. Came today and it was all dry. We both did big combo plates and pretty much everything was dry.  Shady black dude behind the counter kept flirting with the wife too. Tacky.  Pass on this place and the place next door which is also quite bad.  2 worth BBQ joints in Phoenix:  #1 - Texas BBQ House  #2 - Little Miss

U_WmT58mlxX35wx-Vjf0oA.text: Lots of seating with no wait. The brisket was very juicy and fresh. I enjoyed a $2.50 beer too. Overall, I recommend this place if you want some juicy brisket and baby back ribs. The price is about the same you'd pay at another BBQ joint.   The meat is wrapped, which scared me at first, but it locks in the flavor pretty nicely. I really enjoyed the barbecue sauce and the pickles were really good.

HUPy2zOEodFzBh5VpiYOwg.text: Today was my third trip to Can't Stop Smokin' in Chandler. The first time I loved it, but the second time it seemed to have some growing pains.  I am so happy we went back today as the brisket was out of this world.  I love bbq and brisket is my favorite - so that is high praise from me.

wcCaWJhznMpk4PCVVM-90Q.text: Best value and taste in town.  Delicious BBQ, big portions, inexpensive, self serve buffet style, so you can see all the dishes. Specials each day, On Tuesday it was any brand of beer for $2.50 !  Casual dining and friendly service.

ByUwBNDHaa-5jlj-rmRTGQ.text: Well, decided to eat here and try it out. If it was OK, nothing spectacular about it except the cobbler. That was really good. Brooks for a little dry, so was the brisket and the tri tip.  They did offer a good selection of side dishes, but they didn't look all that great. The corn bread again was a little dry. Might try again, but I'm going to try the competitor across the street next time and compare.

m6-hKDwk2HHri3if4fWweQ.text: After spending the entire day at the races we were super hungry and we decided to try BBQ.  Stopped in at Rudy's BBQ first (directly across the street) but there was a huge line so we thought we'd try this place instead. I ordered a BBQ chicken sandwich with mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese. The sweet gal serving up the food (on a plate on a tray - cafeteria style) told me she's bring me different potatoes after slopping some on my plate (they were runny). EVERYTHING I tried to eat was horrible! I'm not that picky but we spent $24 on food for me to throw most if it away and leave to spend more money at a nearby Paradise Bakery. I suppose now I might know why there wasn't a line at this place.   The business atmosphere itself was cool, and the kids working were sweet, but the food is something worst than that found in an old elementary cafeteria. I wouldn't feed the stuff to my dog.   Save your money and go elsewhere. Unless and until they fix their food (bland, dry, slop) we won't return.  Lots of other great eateries nearby.

QidOUGC_sv9vasZ5u5Ix4g.text: Awesome stuff and friendly staff.  We got take out for a dinner with friends...it was GREAT.   turkey, sausage, pork and sides plus cobblers.    Love it because it's local too!  They have a private room for gatherings too.

w5-T4cZCgtRacro2zabZ0g.text: So, I decided to stop here after being on some kind of BBQ kick and hitting up Rudy's yesterday. I wanted to give this place a shot since its right next door to Rudy's.  I don't know if its on purpose, but I think its kinda funny that their side by side.  Kind of like a gas station next door to, well, another gas station.  I came in and the place was kinda quiet. It's a sweltering Sunday afternoon and I figured people were probably at home abusing their air conditioning.  Clearly, I was the only one not doing so! Place was quiet, with quiet a few older folks eating here ahead of me in line.  It's a buffet style setup, where you go and order your food, pay, then go sit down.  They had a really good selection of choices in regards to meat selection, and I'm really happy with their sides.  I went with the brisket sandwich, but wanted garlic mashed potato's,  Me and my mashed potato's dammit!  UGH they were OUT! So, I got potato slices and a thing of corn.  Total bill was just under $10.    But here's the weird thing.  First, at the register, they offered me lemonade or ice tea...or fountain pop for a $1 extra.  I obviously went with the fountain pop for the extra dollar.  Also, kudos to this place for having a variety of sauces available at the tables for BBQ dressings.  Yes!  Also, the area where you get your supplies only has room for one tray when you go to get your pop, along with your silverware and everything else. Kind of a tight squeeze of there's other people trying to get stuff at the same time you are. Might as well put your tray down and come back for drinks and everything else.  Place is well decorated and easy to spot from the road.

t0y4DyjYClJpCwQCheL0hg.text: Haven't even started on our "to go" dinner yet.  This GLOWING review is about fabulous customer service.  Our driver got lost and didn't arrive until closing time.  When we called to explain the situation, they took the order over the phone and WAITED for us to arrive.  Now THAT'S great business.  We'll be back to review the food tomorrow.

qt_Xo_HD7rWYkRXWaUUyLA.text: Spur of the moment BBQ dinner - I chose the special of 3 boneless meats, a side, cornbread, and a drink for $9.95. I got the pulled pork, tri-tip, and sirloin and mashed potatoes with gravy. The portion sizes were decent for the price, and the beef was very tender and well-prepared. I did not particularly like the pulled pork, but that might be more about my personal preference than their quality. The mashed potatoes were a bit bland (um. They're mashed potatoes. Aren't they SUPPOSED to be bland?) but I liked the gravy. The cornbread was very flavorful, with pieces of corn and jalapeno. We had cherry pie ($2.00 a piece? Yes thank you!) a la mode for dessert - the crust was light and flaky, and the filling was rich with whole cherries. Prefab cups of ice cream were a bit low budget, but it certainly didn't ruin the experience. The gentlemen behind the grill were very pleasant and helpful - in spite of my first-time indecisiveness - and the young lady at the register was equally friendly. I'd definitely go back or order their take-out.

rSwwSWeGFePu_2kVAD832Q.text: The food at this place was two stars. As others have mentioned, the meat is dry and lacks flavor. My hubby was very happy to see that they had beef ribs available but the price they charged for one (literally just one rib) was the same as you pay for a half rack everywhere else. I don't mind paying a little more at a full service place like Lucille's but if you are going to do the same cafeteria style no-frills service as the place next door, you better make sure that your food is just as good and your prices are competitive.  I see no reason to ever come here again but I added a half star for having a better choice of side dishes than a lot of other BBQ joints. I hate it when BBQ places only have coleslaw and corn, yuck! The mac and cheese and spicy pinto beans I ordered at my sides were nothing special but edible. And plus another half star for offering Left Hand Brewery's milk stout. For those of you who haven't tried it, please do so immediately, it is the most delicious beer you will ever drink. And I found out last week that it goes pretty well with barbeque!

JYWML4aUmZKL9FNg0GrdhQ.text: I went here a few days ago for dinner and have to say I was VERY impressed!  It was my first time at this place and I really loved the food, service and atmosphere. I thought the prices were very reasonable as well. I am very picky about BBQ food and I ordered the chicken , which was very good... I liked that the drink was included in the price of the meal. Its cafeteria style and very easy to navigate through. Great portion sizes and there was plenty of seating in the restaurant. Nice casual atmosphere.. very nice employees as well.. I will definitely go back here...

9ZNeU1hgY1haF-LVCtl3pQ.text: Not bad, had 1/2 rack if baby back ribs and potatoes. Good smoke flavor and spicy sauce was good. Only downside was that all the meat was wrapped in plastic, which tells me not cooked today.

BLrsNbMa-QOzs3RGVZ325A.text: BarBQ as good as any other in Arizona.    As a displaced Texan, I'm searching for some decent pit BarBQ.  Can't Stop Smokin sounded good, smelled good, has friendly helpful staff, but sadly still falls short of good Texas Bar BQ.    I've pretty much decided only a drive or flight home will satisfy my craving.  So don't think badly of the Smokin folks.     I got some sliced brisket and some sausage.    Brisket is the acid test for great BarBQ.   It should have a distinct smoky flavor and a reddish smoke ring 1/4 to 1/2 inch across.   This brisket was moist, good flavor, but had almost invisible smoke ring.   It was presliced in a steam table pan.   Sausage was a kielbasa type fine texture sausage.   Also moist but sliced to order.   I got canned green beans and fresh cooked carrot coins for sides.   Passable steam table fare.     Cornbread muffin was cakey and sweet with some whole kernel corn and jalapaneo bits.   I prefer cornmeal only cornbread.   Guess most Arizonan's like flour and sugar in their cornbread.   I'll pass on the bread next time.    Overall, I preferred the meal at Smokin as much or more than Rudy's Texas BarBQ - across the street.   The staff was definitely more engaging and helpful at Smokin.     Still searching for Texas quality BarBQ, but starting to accept its not available in Arizona.  Four stars for steam table style of service.  I'll be back with adjusted expectations.

ga3lJImO8S9FTXeEPKdaNg.text: I am a professional, I work crazy hours and my family loves to eat out. We eat out all the time, so ordering BBQ is a treat since BBQ delivery is quite unusual.  The initial three or four times some things were super tasty while other menu items where questionable, as if it was not cooked all the way, or the thought of "am I even eating a real potato" would be lingering while we ate. My honey loved the tri-tip and brisket, while my cousin would always order the sausage sandwich.  Over the last year in a half possibly more there have been times where items from our order would be missing, which was always made right my giving us a free side the next order or what not.  But after at least ordering over five times it seemed silly to keep ordering mediocre food if menu items where dissatisfying, or entirely invisible.  I'm not sure if it is being managed the same as before but for what we initially paid for, we would have more food, and literally BOTTLES of there  BBQ sauce with our order. The rolls used to be the best part of ordering but now they seem to taste like the bread my grandma would dry out to feed birds at the park.  This last time I ordered (THE last time), we ordered two double tri-tip combos, a tri-tip rib combo, and a tri-tip kids meal. There was an additional half rib which was never delivered, the delivery gentleman who I believe was the owner was cordial and pleasent- even delivering the food quickly. We realized we were missing the side of ribs and called, informing them the ribs were missing from our order and were told they would be delivered. Only to be called back minutes later and told the owner packed our order and knew they were in there.   This place is either trying to push away customers or they think they only serve certain kinds of customers with respect. Been in customer service for 10 years and that was the most ridiculous excuse for customer service ive ever witnessed. My boyfriend didn't even want to mention it because he was so done. But I called back and let them know that we will not be ordering from them anymore. Our order was $50 and I know for a fact we've ordered over $500 total from this place. Not any more! This is Tempe and is full of other places to blow that money on.  Bottomline unprofessional. #byefelicia

__mTrhBZolmeuJ16ZdWckw.text: Loved the food and the awesome customer service here. I purchased the Groupon before coming to visit my daughter....and I had no regrets!  The brisket had a great smoky flavor that reminded me of Texas. All the sides were delicious and the desserts were yummy too. The best part....the beers were very inexpensive!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

07FQiJkqw03pRhW-l9gt0Q.text: If there was a way to give negative stars I would.  The food was OK at best but the service was awful.  Rudy's was packed and this place was wide open so we thought we would give it a shot.  Now we know why the place was dead.  We wait 30 minutes for corn on the cob.  We asked multiple times for it and they finally opted to argue with us about whether we paid for it or not.  We also tried pies.  The Frys bakery pie was much better and not $17!  Do yourself a favor and to to Rudy's and wait in line.  They won't run out of food on you and the staff will be happy to serve you.

uNuY2zUia1DfQBt557tArQ.text: Awesome turkey and pulled pork! We love the sides - mac and cheese, carrots, spinach mashed potatoes. The BBQ sauce is perfect, the price is great, especially for the kids meals. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Don't pass this place up!!

Uio5Hv7_Cq72QPcsbJ_fjg.text: This was such an odd experience.  Have you ever eaten somewhere with some food that is AMAZING and some that is quite possibly the worse you have ever tried to eat?  If so, then you've probably already eaten here.   I went in for a quick bbq fix with average expectations judging from the average reviews. . . so I assumed that everything would be just average.  Little did I know I would be in store for some great food and some horrible food from the same place.   I had the brisket, pulled pork, corn, and garlic roasted potatoes. My wife had a half BBQ chicken, mac n cheese, and some cobbler (I can't remember the flavor but she devoured it so I guess it was good). We both opted for dinner rolls because we don't like jalapenos.   The Brisket was really moist and had a nice flavor and was probably the best I've had outside of Texas.  The pulled pork was pretty good too and more importantly meaty.  A lot of places you get pulled pork there is a lot of fat in it but not here.  I tried some of my wife's chicken and it was nice and tender with a light Smokey flavor.    But all things can't be good.  My corn tasted like it was burnt and had no flavor at all, possibly freezer burnt?  The garlic potatoes were so dry they were crispy.  The mac n' cheese wasn't very creamy and had a thick consistency, possibly microwaved?  And the dinner roll, well . . .  it was as hard as a rock and at least a week old.    Bottom line:  Go here for the barbeque, take it home, then make your own sides.  The barbeque is really good and clearly where all of the effort goes.  The sides are high school cafeteria quality.  I would guess the sides are frozen, microwaved, then kept under a heat lamp for hours, maybe even days, until it sells out.

TamoziU2DxUa3i504n-otw.text: All combos come with soft drink. Great BBQ!

C-2hR_NWL5mSulhsLKPl_w.text: I wanted to like this place.. I really did. I was completely underwhelmed with Rudy's across the street so I was hoping CSS would be good enough to be a regular spot to go for BBQ.  On the plus side, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the restaurant itself has a nice western feel to it. Unfortunately, for me and my family, the food fell a little short. I should have known when we were there at 6:00pm on Father's Day, and there was no line. I'm not a fan of cafeteria style as there's something completely unappetizing about seeing the food you're about to eat wrapped in plastic wrap. It reminds me of left overs..and I guess that's what it tasted like. But, I decided to make the best of it and give it a shot. I have no idea how long that food was sitting on the line, but I suspect it was there for quite a while.  I ordered "Pete's Pick" (at least I think that's what it was called) because I wanted to try a little sampling of the various offerings. Well, that's what I got.. a LITTLE sampling. The plate was literally about 2-3 bites of each meat (Brisket, Sausage, Pulled Pork) and 2 ribs. If there was more than 1/2 lb of meat total, I'd be surprised. I don't think it was worth the $16 they charge for it. I don't mind paying for good food, but I don't like getting small portions of cafeteria grade food for sit down restaurant prices.   My wife had the "big" tri-tip sandwich. I come from an area in California where Tri-Tip is religion (Santa Maria style anyone?) so I was looking forward to getting at least a bite of her sandwich. I giggled as I saw them slice off 3-4 really thin slices of beef (probably not even 1/4 lb.) and put it on a monstrous bun then dump sauce on it. The "Big" must be referring to the bun. Unfortunately, the meat was dry. And given my wife's love of tri-tip and her unwillingness to finish the sandwich, I decided to pass on asking for a bite and took her word for it that it wasn't good.  My son ordered a two meat combo. I don't know if the guy behind the counter was attempting to be funny or if he was serious, but when my son asked for chicken, while looking at a whole pan full of it, he was told they didn't have any and wouldn't have any for about 30 minutes. I guess they didn't want to cut up any of the whole chickens that were sitting there (must have been at least 4 whole chickens there) My son just shrugged and went with the Baby Back Ribs and Sausage. He's a pretty laid back kid. He ate one rib...he NEVER eats just one rib. Unfortunately, the ribs were dry and tasteless if you didn't add sauce. It's disappointing when I know I make better ribs than the BBQ restaurant does.  In general, the meats were dry and/or flavorless. The brisket was moist, but how could it not be with all the fat that was in it? A smoke ring was non-existent. The sausage was bland and completely forgettable. The pulled pork wasn't too bad, but nothing to write home about. The sides were all pretty bland. The baked beans tasted like they came out of a can. Potatoes were bland. Cornbread was dry.   I'm not sure if I'll go back to this place or not. I may give them another shot after they've been open long enough to work out the kinks. I hope they see these reviews and make some changes in how they prepare the food. It could go a long way, especially with another BBQ joint just across the street. The food is my only knock on this place, but unfortunately, the food is the biggest reason I go to a restaurant.

hydpJ4LYTrCM8gZ7X90iOQ.text: Decided to give this place a shot since who doesn't love BBQ.  First off, this place isn't really a restaurant.  It's basically of BBQ cafeteria.  I ordered the brisket which was moist but it didn't blow me away.  Their BBQ sauces on the table were only okay.  Nothing spectacular.  Where I'm really disappointed with this place came to the sides.  I had the worst mac & cheese ever from here!  It had zero flavor whatsoever!!  I also had mashed potatoes with gravy which was also bland as can be.  I will NOT come back here unless they improve and they give me a free meal to give them another chance.  I would NOT recommend this place and I'm going to give Rudy's across the street a chance to see how they compare to this dump.

ksGzH4DUB1xYXE02QBYW7g.text: Went here for work did not like the food. It. Taste like straight smoke. The sides had no flavor and wasn't even warm. The only thing I would give them is they had hot workers ;-) . there workers acted to good to talk or help though they knew they were hot. Very bad, will not go back again.

XqgNbzX08SCdpCgEIuLA5w.text: So my husband and I are always on the look out for new BBQ joints, since hes from Memphis TN its always hard to find something decent. HIs parents went to Rudys across the street in the past and said it was terrible, so we thought we'd check out 'cant stop smokin' bbq'. We pulled in to a barely empty parking lot. We went inside and we greeted immediately by the hostess and she explained the style of ordering and seating of the restaurant. We order off a line like cafeteria style - you pick you meat- your sides - your drink, and then you pay at the end and sit wherever you like. I decided I was going to go for the #4 combo with 6 st louis style ribs and i chose macaroni salad and cole slaw, a slice of apple pie  and a lemonade. My husband chose the combo Pete's Pick which comes with 2 baby back ribs, smoked sausage, brisket, pulled pork and he added carnitas and his sides were mac n cheese and cole slaw and a sweet tea.  Both of us also got the jalapeno corn bread. Now my husband and I have had our fair share of BBQ, and i will say that this was by far the one of the worst bbq we have ever had. My meal was absolutely gross. The st louis ribs were clearly not fresh, they were completely falling off the bone and completely fatty and flavorless. The macaroni salad tasted like gross store bought macaroni salad and the cole slaw tasted like a horrible version of the KFC cole slaw. I thought the lemonade was supposed to be fresh they had tropicana lemonade which is nasty so i decided to taste the so called sweet tea.. the tea was watered down and didn't even taste sweet. And the corn bread was dry. My apple pie tasted like store bought apple pie as well. My husbands food was just as bad. Brisket, baby back ribs, pulled pork, and sausage all flavorless. he too thought the cole slaw tasted like a bad version of KFC's and the mac and cheese tasted like it came from their too.  If you are looking for a good BBQ place 'cant stop bbq' is not the place for you. And if any of you reading this review thinks that this place is good bbq your crazy and you obviously haven't had the real deal yet. Frankly if you are looking for a great st louis rib check out Loucilles BBQ at Tempe Market Place or even at Dave's BBQ.   Also i think its hilarious if you check out their website that all of the reviews are fantastic and they are rated at a 98% by the customers, but if you go to the internet reviews like yelp or urbanspoon you are getting realistic reviews.

8UZ-o72vxeUjoFyZzTjkZA.text: I'm giving this place two stars because my wife thought her sliders were pretty good.  My meal however was below one star.  I absolutely love Beef Ribs, and as those of you who live in the Phoenix metro area know, they are hard to find here.  I ate at Can't Stop Smokin' on opening day, and the ribs were not bad at all, Expensive, but pretty good.  We ate there again 2 weeks ago, and the ribs were charcoal with absolutely no taste.  Burnt to a crisp!  I should have returned them, but had had a big day and didn't want to cause a scene.  I ate one of the two ribs and threw the second one away.  It was terrible.  I left a review on their web site, but they apparently don't care because I never heard back from them.  I will never eat there again.  Rudy's is out because they don't serve Beef Ribs.  I guess my quest continues.

b3LzHrRCQD28ifbK3I-nvQ.text: There was nothing really wrong with this place, however it just did not really appeal to me. My family and I went here recently for my dad's birthday and nothing was very impressive. We went around seven on a Saturday night and you would have thought they were getting ready to close. There was almost no one there and the place just didn't have much energy. I did like the building, as it was all carved wood and made me feel like I was up in the woods, but it also had an elderly vibe to it. Rudy's across the street seemed a lot more lively. The food was good but nothing to rave about.

GtU5rz12K65zLU7ajc9l7g.text: Tried for the 1st time. Really liked how quiet it was. Had sauce warmers if you like your sauce heated. I had the chicken and brisket. A little on the dry side but excellent smoked flavor. A little of their warmed classic sauce and it was perfect. My husband had the smoked tri-trip and sausage. Very good. They give you 2 sides, corn and baked rolls. I had the macaroni and cheese and apple cobbler. The best cobbler I have had in a long time. All for under $10 and free drink. We'll be coming back for sure

jIzZbVhPy01__neA-B6MgQ.text: As a Texan, this is the best BBQ I've had in Arizona!  The food is awesome.  The staff is friendly and eager to serve.  The establishment is beautiful and clean.  I highly recommend this place! Love it!

pho-D7f2zEML1hYUaF_zew.text: This place is destined to fail.  I have to agree with the other negative reviews, and I wish I had read them before we came here.  It is built right next to another barbecue place, so inevitably they are going to be compared.  Rudy's wasn't very good, but it's way better than Can't Stop.  So why would we ever come back?  My wife and I ate here tonight, and $21 later, about half of our food was in the trash.  As others have said, the food is bland.  There's not much to say.  We got a few different kinds of meat, a few different kinds of sides... nothing worth talking about.  The service was horrible.  When we first walked in, people were looking around confused, because they had no idea where to go or what to do.  Finally a rude girl came up and told the older couple in front of us that they could sit anywhere, and handed them some menus.  They wandered off not knowing that it's cafeteria style, and the line was right around the corner.  I wonder if they ever got to eat anything.  After the rude girl's (seriously, who hires someone like this and puts her out front?) useless, condescending explanation to us, we waited in line.  Two people in front of us and we still had to wait about five minutes.  The people working the counter are not very well trained.  I know it's a new place... but come on, it's been a week.  Get your act together already.  Oh, and I just read in other reviews that the sauce is kept warm (ours wasn't??) and you can put a wooden nickel into a bowl or something for charity??  None of this was explained, and I didn't see it happen.  Oh well.  Guess we still have to drive to Joe's or Famous Dave's to get decent barbecue.

e9R7h31Caz4idV_1ZiRNKw.text: Worst BBQ place I've been to. No flavor to any of the food. Chicken and carnitas was tasteless. If things don't improve they won't last six months!

CNcW5TxV3hOpptmuyUxFmA.text: We stumbled across this BBQ place while spending the night in the Phoenix area.  We are from Texas so like to think we know BBQ.  This place was fantastic.  The price was good and the food was great And they have pies too.  We got a whole (to go) multi berry pie and it was really good right to the last bite!  I would definitely go there again when in the area. The service is cafeteria style, grab a tray and pick out what you want - typical BBQ.  the decorations were also typical BBQ so it was comfortable. The staff was exceptionally friendly.  The lady was a sweetheart.  I think her enthusiasm made the place that much more enjoyable!

vu7Z_GWq00qakAXH3R4EfQ.text: I worked at BBQ restuarant for years and every since then I have been trying to find a place close to that here in the valley.  This place is great.    The employees were very friendly and helpful in explaining how there restuarnt works.  I did try the place across the street before I came to this one and I will say Can't Stop Smokin BBQ blows the other one out fo the water.  For one I like to have a table when i go out to eat.  It is also nice that I can order my meal as a combo rather than have to order my food by the pound.  The BBQ was great here. I had the pulled pork which was great and the brisket.  i liked how the brisket was smoked.  Crisp on the outside and tender on the inide- perfect.  I will for sure be a frequent customr of this place.

cdZ2ObsbtvPnvRdwT8MNCA.text: Brisket was moist & very tender, not too fatty and the sides tasty. Pulled Pork was good, Brisket is better than Rudy's, but the Pulled Pork and Sausage is a toss up. I have not ventured into chicken or ribs yet, I keep going back to that Brisket!

Sm4OrotL7nw6jh1F2Nwy2g.text: I am a huge fan of this restaurant . My son is in love with the smoked sausage and rightfully so, it's delicious. The ribs are flavorful and have the right smokeyness to them, and I don't know if I got lucky one day but the smoked turkey leg(which is my main reason to travel to the renaissance fair every year) was amazing! I probably eat here once or twice a week and the workers know when I walk in that I'm getting a full link of sausage for my son and they always cut it up for him (he's almost 2) which is one of the main reasons I will not step foot in rudys. I will give five stars for the meat and customer service alone, BUT there is major room for improvement here and that is the sides. They are sometimes seasoned well and sometimes bland. I feel like they personally need more variety and flavors on the sides, maybe a creamed corn or spinach? In my mind the meat is the centerpiece but people remember side dishes! Just a thought. ......

L2aeRITkMdhbjDK9EICvKw.text: I went there last week for the 1st time. Lovely decor. Food was great' I tried their chopped beef sandwich. The sauce has a sweet BBQ flavor. The meat was tender and very flavor able. sides were good also.

8KhVjZfFCBCgN4ZF0mTErw.text: So much better than Rudy's! Better food, quieter, better layout than Rudy's! Some of the BEST tri-tip I've had outside of Ventura/Santa Maria area.

a3Bd3ic_UKGXbAxzC3fChg.text: Running errands durring the day and stopped here to grab some lunch.  First impression was it's a clean, nicely designed, restaurant with heavy timber decor and metal baking sheets for trays.  Second impression was "who lets their brisket sit in a steamer pan floating in water??"  Coming from 7 years in OKC and 22 years in Dallas, no self-respecting BBQ vendor presents their brisket floating in water.  Plenty of sides, a'la cafeteria style, and that was cool, but asked the guy behind the counter to lean out the brisket for me, since it had plenty of fat on it, and didn't do a very good job.  You see, I HATE fat.  Anyway, the smoked sausage was pretty good, but they had no fried okra, which where I came from is a BBQ house staple.  They did have sweet tea, which I am fond of.  Anyway, the gal at the cash register was pleasant enough, but it doesn't make up for the flavor of the brisket (interesting, if you let your brisket float in it's own fat juice, it ends up tasting like fat!)  So, for me, this is not a place I will return to . . . just wasn't my cup of tea.

RK5ap2xwRdO62jaN4W8Llw.text: Super good bbq!!! Jalapeno corn bread on point. The staff super friendly! Its not not bbq if the sauce is on the meat and this place is bomb!

wfCELa2PoCj04hRiFfs6Ng.text: If you're questioning whether or not to try this place, DO IT!  This was a random stop we decided to take when we got lost looking for a different place we were going to eat.. OMG the BBQ was amazing!! I ordered the ribs with mashed potatoes & steamed carrots. The ribs were literally fall off the bone, mashed potatoes were definitely not any type of packaged or frozen potatoes, and the carrots were steamed to perfection. Hubby ordered kielbasa sausage, mashed potatoes, and macaroni & cheese. He was super pleased with everything and was happy to see the portions of meat they give you. Let's just say they aren't shy with the portions.   We were a little nervous at first because the place wasn't very busy but it should be packed based on the experience we had. Like I said the food was to die for and the customer service was very wonderful. It's not your average restaurant so they walked us through the entire process. If you're looking for a quick stop but not fast food quality, this place is a mix with its restaurant quality food, but the buffet style walk up and get your food right away.

StlxFJB2HpqNve_13Z4HqQ.text: The meats were great, I usually do not like ribs, I know you are thinking why would you order BBQ if you don't like ribs well...I loved the ribs from this place, and the sausage and the carnitas. The sides were also good. We ordered the Family Picnic and the St. Louis Ribs for the brother-in-law. Very pleased would definitely recommend this place. Don't want to go out...Uber Eats way to go!

-CmMOKXTmSuicVBsUvYr7g.text: It is clear that BBQ mean different things not only regionally but globally. Perhaps my experience at Can't Stop Smokin' is a result of what BBQ means to me and that meaning is flavor!  While this restaurant serves up decent offerings, it is hard for me to consider it BBQ since the flavor, smoke, and sauce or rub is extremely lacking. Even their side dishes were very bland. It's like what Taco Bell is to authentic Mexican food. This is BBQ for the masses, non complex, safe, and average. The sausage has no char or snap, the ribs have no smoke or flavor. You have to dump sauce on the meat to get any flavor.   The price point is ok and the service is good but it just wasn't a memorable experience.

IJItWMcajLSiAoWz7Jb6Cw.text: Dry.  Chicken-dry.  Tri-tip dry.  Brisket-dry. Carnitas very dry.   Green beans not dry but mushy.  Much better BBQ across the street.

dnxIyE9zIazpyq3w5q0AUw.text: Pretty much agree with what Alan J. V said. It's a nice place, but so much of the food is bland.  We got a Groupon deal for the picnic platter thing that had 2 lbs of meat total, 3 sides, and even got free cobbler since it's free on Fridays...LOTS of food. We got pulled chicken, beef brisket, pork sausage for mains; beef brisket was good, had a nice smoky flavor. Chicken and pork sausage were okay, but really needed salt or something. The sides were lackluster (mashed potatoes, mac, and baked beans), but the beans were really super-bland. Toss some molasses in 'em, guys! We got corn bread that seemed like it was a "third-party" corn bread they had heated up. The barbecue sauce at their condiment station is not so good, either; came home and put Trader Joe's KC sauce on the leftovers, made it so much better. The cobbler was nice.  I was impressed with how nice and helpful all the staff was, especially the girl who did our order; I imagine she gets tired of going through how it works numerous times each day, but she was peppy and explained things like she was super-interested. The confusion is that they have "premium meats" that they upcharge $4 for, which is disappointing but I guess makes sense (The premium ones are bone-in stuff like ribs and tri-tips).  Atmosphere is nice, very homey.

cs4yd_2281e_rAd7uQZpmA.text: I ordered this for my work, and everyone loved it! The meat was amazing, the sides were delicious! I will definitely be ordering from here again! Also, the delivery guys were great! Set everything up for us!!

0tWm2lqGRMH0Knqn3lAwBQ.text: Stopped in for lunch. Very impressed.   I went with the double meat platter with brisket for both.  Every piece of meat  contained equal amount of smoky goodness.  Coleslaw and baked beans for sides were above average as well.  This place is very clean, with upbeat atmosphere.  Employees were all very friendly and professional.   We will definitely come back again.

JY72fGOtB0tiGdU0FtOQ3A.text: Horrible! Noooooooooooooooo Words! To say... Just hooooorible  to me! HOW COULD THEY!

OVyD_3ogcZdBfrqLopMWVQ.text: Very peppery. Bbq sauce is bitter and gross. I definitely would not eat here again. Everything tasted like pepper. Want good bbq-go to Lucilles in Tempe. I will say the ribs we're good quality but the peppery taste and bbq sauce ruined them. I literally wiped my ribs off and put bbq sauce from my refrigerator on them. The bbq chicken flavor was below average. The corn on the cob waa good. The mashed potatoes were peppery and not edible. Brisket was tender but had a below average flavor; too smokey.

hVNMHXcRRvJVn9_qV0rLMA.text: Don't order online lost my order. Had to scramble for my fourth party. What'd to order for party for next day.  Very disappointed.

ARlBQy9yM0xnbRYMrZdXKA.text: WOW!  The food was reasonably priced, the portions were very large and it was easy for us to split a #5 combination.  We are only disappointed that there isn't one on the northwest side of town.

evU9FdxHPwFhtsU7igjNeQ.text: Mediocre at best. Barbecue had zero taste and the brisket had a bad texture. Sides were average. Apple cobbler was good though. Unfortunately won't be returning. Made my stomach very unhappy by the way.

k_C-Yh0pCYOyfpumcWBT9w.text: Ended up here because Rudy's next door was out if Chicken and so glad I did. The food was so good. More options of sides, meat was cooked to perfection and the service was great. It's a much nicer seating set up as you have booth option. I was very happy with everything and glad I walked in. Excellent!!!

b_Yp2OZGnDZ-tcOtTtGuNA.text: We've eaten here before and it was great.  Today, not so much. The beef ribs that they charge an arm and a leg for,  were awful! The manager was of no help. We used to look forward to eating here, not anymore.

KDHzknqqfonuGjC6ILGxow.text: The food was a mixed bag(see below) but the service was great. The brisket and pulled pork were good, but I wish they also offered a Carolina-style vinegar based sauce to go with the pulled pork. The sausage casing was tough rather than crispy or snappy, and the carnitas are awful. (There are many places in PHX that served real carnitas--these weren't even close.) The mustard greens were great, the slaw was just ok, and the cornbread muffin was atrocious. (I'm from the South, so I know good cornbread.)  The other issue I have is that the board listing their to-go BBQ "by the pound" is a bit misleading. You have to read the small print to realize that the prices listed are actually for just a half-pound. When I pointed that out to the employees, one of them just said, "Well, the owners are German."  As if that explained everything ( well, I guess it does explain the terrible carnitas and cornbread?) I probably won't eat here again. It's not good enough for me to get excited about revisiting.

YUqlpuxt4_o_9zYbKrYvSw.text: Rainy Thursday night in Chandler, I'm on my anti-carb kick this month, so a meal of meat should do the trick.  1lb of Turkey and I was recommended the sausage over the trip tip steak. Not a fan. Both to me were very flavorless and bland. Even the spicy BBQ sauce was lack luster.  Staff was nice and the atmosphere was your typical BBQ joint. It just didn't do it for me. I'm in the area every Thursday night, maybe I'll stop in again and try something else.

cZZhukjx16uu3SLRJWVhOA.text: I had recently came back from a trip to Texas and I was a little skeptical that I'd even like it, but I'm so happy we went in! This is my absolute fav bbq joint in town! And it brings so many good memories from really amazing bbq places in Texas! I'd definitely recommend this place to family and friends! Amazing service, food portions and price! Cannot beat!

NS6i_TZM-3KBYmuoy4TGvQ.text: This is a True gem! Their BBQ is exceptional! My favorite sides are the Mac n cheese, spinich mashed potatoes, and baked beans! The cobbler is delicious! The staff is also very friendly and checks on you often, but not too much that its annoying. The cooking is very home-style, and you feel right at home right when you sit down!! I definitely recommend this place, and its not as cafeteria as Rudy's

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

u-bZDNXJ1FK2uOXzMeuY8g.text: Place isn't very welcoming. Confusing as soon as you walk in the door. Stood there with a group for 5 minutes because we didn't know whether to sit ourselves down or not. Even an employee noticed we were there standing & still didn't bother to guide us. Turned out we had to order our food first & got a look on what's available in the display. Food looked like it was sitting there for quite a while. Ordered the sausage, brisket, Mac & cheese & mashed potatoes. Sausages was OK. Everything else was pretty much bland. Food was also room temp, which didn't help. To conclude I wouldn't come back.

6hTrEIIwh4VuzdxJPYsWyg.text: If you want some good barbecue you need to get to can't stop smokin' barbecue. The sausage, brisket, and original baked beans are phenomenal! The first time we went we got Pete's Pick, which is a $15 combo plate. But if you want to try a lot of different choices, this is the item to get on the menu. The staff was very friendly and helpful when trying to choose different items. The only bad thing I have to say about this place is that their bread is not warm, most their food is not piping hot. But if you care about flavor not about the hottest temperature wise food, you can't go wrong here. The second time we went there, my girlfriend and I got the four-person picnic deal. We ate about half the food there, and took the other half home. Which ended up giving us about three more meals when we get home.

WrMyOc2hPb2LGAbAgxU4PA.text: It's ooooookay, but I don't think we'll be going back, especially with Rudy's right across the street.   I didn't want to compare the two but it has become our go to for BBQ.  No hostess to greet or give direction or guidance to first timers.  Dislike.  It started out a tad confusing.  The method in which you order is almost like a cafeteria.  Kinda like Souper Salad or Bonanza (remember Bonanza?)  Seems awkward.  Maybe that's because of the service that was behind the counter. Came here for linner  (late lunch/early dinner) and we both went with the #3 combo.  Carnitas and tri tip, mustard greens, jalapeno corn bread, corn on the cob, and peach cobbler for me, sausage and Carnitas, green beans, jalapeno corn bread, corn on the cob, and blackberry cobbler for my son. Method used to weigh meat was questionable.  Both Carnitas and tri tip had too much fat on meat.  Corn was soggy. Other veggies were mediocre. Son wanted to leave as soon as we were done eating because he said he smelled formaldehyde.  I know a few friends like this place better than the competition across the street but that's fine with me cuz that just means fewer people in line to order -at Rudy's.

LNb4LjjLeptwHs37pOQz9w.text: CSS is my favorite barbecue restaurant in the Phoenix metro. I've had nothing but good experiences with the service and the food. The counter employees will let you sample the different menu items to help you decide what you'd like to order and take the time to explain the different options to you. The food itself is very reasonably priced, and the portions are huge-- I always leave stuffed. I frequently hear people rave about how Joe's or Rudy's has the best barbecue, but I've tried Joe's and my husband tried Rudy's, and we weren't impressed. CSS has good meats AND good sides, and in my eyes, if your restaurant doesn't have both, you don't have a leg to stand on. I'll keep coming back to CSS for my barbecue fix.

S2V5bYt3yKRXUwG79_-Ufg.text: Just got 27.00$ worth of food it wasnt what i was expecting .. all i taste is liquid smoke its mushy , dry and my coldslaw came warm along with my soggy biscuit .. wont eat here again when we walked into the resturant all the food was out for display cooked in shrink wrap shoulda turned around right then .. blah

DC2tTjaok2j5oNoB8DB7fw.text: Just finished eating dinner from here for the first time.  A deal on Groupon brought us in, and the food will bring is back!  We had brisket that was cooked to perfection.  The pulled pork was delicious and flavorful.  Everything was moist and tender.  All of our sides were really great as well.  The cobbler was a great ending to our meal.  I have to say, not only was the meat fantastic, but for having lots of young kids working there, the customer service was great!  Everyone working there was helpful and polite.  My family and I will be back again!

RPZgfUhcVM-oOPV_Drc38A.text: Good brisket, mac & cheese and sausage.  The ribs dry rub was kinda bland.  The slow service of this place makes me not want to come back. The BBQ sauces was not the greatest.

K7tYod_j3JtIValeeUpz_g.text: This place is exactly as advertised, BBQ the way that it should be. The line moved super fast which was great because I was starving when I showed up. I expected decent BBQ when I showed up I didn't expect some of the best green beans I've ever had and the mustard greens, whoo! I've had some good BBQ in my day, the Salt Lick in Austin, Texas even which is some of the best BBQ in the country and I can say the BBQ at Can't Stop stacked up. The Tri Tip was so good with the spicy BBQ sauce it literally made me go cross eyed! If you want mouth watering BBQ check this place out, you won't be disappointed!

qon8uNA12NUDBDI1brMrSg.text: No clue why this place averages three stars, because it is delicious!!! The pulled pork and brisket are some of the best I've had. Also, they let you try anything you want before ordering, so you can be sure to find something you love. Highly recommend you eat here and skip the more commercial Rudy's next door! The staff is super friendly too!

0bwM_XlzZBXxJc8MtdyqPQ.text: I'm still trying to find an authentic BBQ place in AZ and this place doesn't cut it.  The brisket was soggy, fatty, and lacked any discernable beef or smoke flavor.   The two BBQ sauces were mediocre at best.  They didn't have that addicting "I can't get enough" flavor.  The turkey breast was slightly better but it was very clear it had been brined as the saltiness of the meat was distracting.  There was a hint of pink indicating that smoke is actually used in their cooking although you couldn't taste it.  Two stars because the restaurant was very clean and well decorated for a BBQ joint, but that alone is not enough to make me return.

iqn-6XxzQhtrceNT61N7wQ.text: Decided to try since they had a great deal on groupon, should of read the reviews first. There was only one family in there wich should of given me a huge hint, we ordered the bbq picnic platter wich was huge but not good at all, baked beans tasted worse than canned beans! The "mashed" potatoes were solid and gravy was super thick. Mac and cheese had no flavor, boxed would probably be ten times better, won't be back.

i5Oz73U_LONcnp0zsvaOpA.text: Well this was not good, not good at all.  Would not go back and would not recommend. Go and try it if you want to walk away hungry and feeling like they should have paid  you to eat there. Not sure how this place is going to make it.

GWz4rfPsWNgr22KXL7-uwQ.text: I wasn't the biggest fan of BBQ before I tried this place. Hands down, the best BBQ I've ever had. I tried a sample of all the meat, and ended up going with the carnitas meat. They were all delicious, carnitas had so much flavor though. The potatoes were amazing, seasoned perfect. I ended my night with some cobbler, which was the best part. I'm a sucker for sweets and their desserts are delicious!! Their affordable price seals the deal. Under 20 bucks for 2 plates (meat, and 2 sides), 2 drinks and dessert. KILLER!!!

4ysU0eSVANNnASudkIvp0g.text: I walked in the door and had to walk past the front desk to realize we had to grab a metal tray and proceed down the line of food. No one to greet you at the door and for newbies, that didn't go over well for me. I give it 2 stars because the food actually tasted ok...but I'm one that doesn't like to see my food slopped in a large pan- that looked like it had been there all day! I pushed my metal tray down the line almost like prison food delivery - it just wasn't appealing...The people working deserve a star for being so sweet...but I would say Rudy's next door is far better...and the presentation is something this place needs to think about.

frupkv2Uj9UJ6NozognCAQ.text: Hello, does anyone work here?  We came in and three people were staring at the menu boards and no one appeared to be working behind the counter. Then a young man comes out with a hot dish for behind the counter. The three people told us to go ahead and even my mother and I were indecisive, being a first time as well. My mom got the Pete's special (one meat, side and chips for $3.99), I said I wanted the same think with the carnitas. He asked me what two sides I wanted and I said, shouldn't it be one side and chips, and he said no it's two. Oh okay, so I got green beans and potato salad. Apparently there is a Pete's Lunch Special for $3.99 and a Lunch Special for $6.99. For the price you do get a large portion, my mom enjoyed her turkey, I wish I felt the same about my carnitas. It was not pulled as I would have expected in a BBQ place, it was cut in hunks. I took a bite and apologized to my mother that I could not eat it. It was tough and fatty. She insisted that I take it back up to the counter and ask for another meat choice. I opted for the brisket which was much better. Two people could definitely share the $6.99 special. There did appear to be a manager there fidgeting with the tvs. I would have expected that he could have walked around asking people how they were doing.   Suggestions:   Shred up the pork, your customers will be happier!  Manager, walk around and greet people, especially when you enter the place or have a host/ess there for some guidance!

Tsx-szQcvv-XRVGFhhBlSg.text: The two and a half stars is about right on this place. The meat was not moist just dry, the corn is left in the water so it's all soggy and when you bite into it, it sprays everyone, the corn bread literally had a taste of dish soap and didn't feel like it was cooked all the way. Overall food was not good.

ci2U2UGDkIpiAu1tQB41jQ.text: Saw it pop up across the street from Rudy's a little while ago,  which I thought was odd to open a BBQ joint right across from another BBQ joint.  I tried Rudy's in the past and thought it was pretty good.  Then I saw a deal chicken for this new place (two meals valued at $24).  Went there for lunch,  got my food,  and at the counter the cashier guys behind the counter realized that my deal chicken was actually for a different restaurant.  I felf like a dumb ass, but they said I was all good, and enjoy the food anyway, on them.   Now that is what I call excellent customer service.     Very nice decor,  definately upscale for a bbq place,  with natural wood tables and TV's in the back room.  Everything was nice and clean.  People there were very friendly.  For the food, I had the hot links,  which smokey, tasty and juicy, and were excellent,  and the brisket,  which was moist and tender, though it did seem to have a spice rub on it which would impart more flavour.    I also had a side of corn on the cob,  which was a little small, but the corn was sweet and tender,  and the potatoes,  which were sliced big like wedge fries,  but tasted more like a baked potatoe in that they were soft and not crispy.    I also had the collard greens and green beans which were very simple, but tasted good. Not spicey or smoky.  They have two sauces,  one that is spicey,  which had a little heat,  and good flavour,  and a plain one that I did not try. Good portions of the meat and sides (except the corn).    There were some smoked turkey legs that looked amazing, that I would like to try on my next visit.   And the pies look like they were made from scratch.  I will have to try those next time as well.  Overall,  with the nice decor,  excellect service, and good food and portions,  I will definately be back to try them again.

ys7WnHG-ohwHIr8oeDy6Ng.text: My husband and I have been trying new places every day for lunch in the Ahwatukee/Chandler area and we tried Rudy's across the street one day and we were not impressed by the sauce or the way we were treated. I felt like cattle in a line to get my food. However when we went to Cant stop smoking the chef Allen treated us amazing. He allowed us to try all the different meat and explained everything to us. He was very patient and the food was GREAT!!! The sauce was real BBQ sauce and Allen even came up to us in the end to make sure we enjoyed everything. Loved it and will be back

BuyR5kzU-Tmq2TZNcHdKIQ.text: Another BBQ place I wanted to like but came short. First - why in the world did they build right next to Rudy BBQ?  Not the place I'd want to compete right next too.  Rudy's is always busy, Can't Stop you pretty much can walk up and order from.  The Service has always been nice.  But that doesn't make up for the food The food and counter were you order reminds me of a hospital cafeteria.  And most of the sides taste like they came from a hospital cafe.    The meats are ok at best.  My favorite is the carnitas.  The brisket was blah and pulled pork ok.    Ambiance is fine.  Plenty of open seats...again not a good thing per say.  I don't see this place lasting another year.

nlbPi0JM18yO4ojDTys_3w.text: I never do a review on here but had too.  Please don't mistake this place for Rudy's next door.  I sent my co-workers to pick-up lunch and they accidently went to this bbq joint instead. The turykey sandwhich was very dry store bought bread and all. I gave them $8 which across the street would have filled me up w/ a sandwhich and side for green chili. The register lady didn't even tell them they were at the wrong place when asking for creamed corn, she said they didn't have it today(they never have it). The pork was dry and tasteless. The soda was flat. The beans were chalky and dry. The bbq sauce taste store bought or a dipping sauce from fastfood place. I really tried to like somehting from this place but even the soda was flat my co-worker said. They told the lady it was their first time( since it was) and she said um ok. Next door they would have given you a platter of samples. Free what's that?  At least if you are going to charge 8$ for a few pieces of meat on dry bread through in some veggies or something.  Never in my life...I cannot understand why this place is still open other than it is family owned so people are supporting them out of the kindness of their heart.  Definently do not quit your day job and eat next door then take notes.  Your food has more flavor just not the heart and soul of a "Real" family owned and operated bbq restuarant.  #icouldmakethisathome

qlGEOIa7tePuGIPkoSPI4g.text: Excellent food.  Period.  No frills just good barbecue.   The staff if friendly and the service is good.  It's a good value and one of the few places in the valley you can get a beef rib!  Don't confuse "can't stop smokin" with Rudy across the street.  I have eaten at both and this place completely outdoes rudys.

WQcFdtv3YGXY4AEChMelgw.text: Not a fan. Thier food is served cafeteria style...looked dry the 1st time I went. Flavor was off...meat is tuff...except the ribs. They wouldn't except my groupon before 2pm. Word of suggestion....go next door. Food is amazing.

AlVHB5iU8sFOGhP3j-rAuA.text: Great food, excellent value for the money. I really love that your food is waiting when you walk in you only have to decide which plate or combo to order.  The food tastes fresh and is never disappointing. Our BBQ go-to in Chandler.  Free outside parking, easy access to the 101 and south 202.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Featuring local brews

en7ihLN5CAjhLZ4ObD7-zQ.text: I love the ribs here at can't stop smoking! I smoke my own ribs at home but after coming here the Last few times, I may have to give it up! Yes they are that good! The turkey legs are pretty good too! If you like sauce, the Classic sauce is way better then the spicy!  I don't use sauce because the smoke flavor and the seasonings on the ribs is all it needs for me. Keep up the smoking!

XeOfjb5pNdq_L_WxOkU7Qw.text: BEST BBQ I have had since I moved to Arizona.  I have tried Joe's BBQ, Dickie's and Famous Dave's. Nothing comes close to this place. EVERYTHING was deeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeelicous! I can't wait to go back. The sausage was incredible, the bbq sauces perfect, and the ribs were so tender and tasty. FINALLY found a BBQ place. THANK U!

x9ux30KFvmmQu8YFA4CuPA.text: We tried the big red place across the street and wasn't impressed with it. So we stopped in here, the brisket and carnitas were outstanding. The beans were excellent. Overall liked it will come back.

rSM9o4a4pNb07IV-gH4IpA.text: Its a hit and miss BBQ place something good something's not . Had a variety of things and the brisket was to say had a nice flavor but the smoke flavor stayed for awhile but not in a good way. made it seem like it was a smoke flavor additive not saying that it was but it lingered and not in a good way. sides are sides some good some bad but one thing they do have is excellent customer service from what I received, help was pleasant and willing to answer questions that I had . It was ok .. nice dining area to sit and eat

tYnGap8ZkiPizH7qTW7Ygg.text: This place was NASTY! Had the half chicken and daughter had the baby back ribs. The sides are awful and look like they had been sitting out all day. The mash potatoes were disgusting. Food is very bland. Tasted worse than hospital cafeteria food! I do not recommend and will never go back!!

V9F-7EjJ40VSs3FCl-KoyQ.text: We ate there for the first time last night and enjoyed every part of our experience.   The parking lot was easily accessible and almost full, a good sign. The host was very friendly as she explained the set-up. It only took a couple of minutes until we were seated and enjoying! He had smoked brisket and I had a juicy smoked chicken breast. We both had spicy pulled pork. All of these were wonderful. The sides we chose garlic potatoes and carrots, tasty. He had the potato salad, fresh and Dill-y. All in all, a great time. We'll be back and tell our friends.

FF8k0WLXuW3eUNPIA7QyZw.text: The best BBQ in all of AZ! Somebody get me some more brisket for christmas! The sauce wasn't the best but I came for the MEAT! oh good goly I was satisfied.  I got a Petes pick and had to unbutton my pants like it was thanksgiving after, BOMB. please explain to me why people still go to rudy's? CAN'T STOP SMOKIN is where it's at!

DlDhS9Ooy_aLGHPwNXWbZg.text: If you are looking for good bbq, don't bother coming here.  Just go across the steet and give Rudy's a try.  Hands down, Rudy's beats this place by a mile.

YJaPxkGwclHReiLp_ik6kA.text: I've been wanting to open a yelp account for quite a while and after reading the reviews about CSS, I was compelled to do so.  I'm confused about the low ratings as my experience has been just the opposite.  I've been to CSS at least 4 times since it opened.  Each time, the food and service has been great.  I've  had the brisket, smoked turkey, smoked chicken, tri-tip, and sausage.  The smoked turkey is possibly the best I've ever had.  Juicy, tender, moist....I get the 2 mean combo which also comes with corn on the cob, 2 sides, choice of cornbread or bisquit? (I get the cornbread), and iced tea or lemonade.....all that for less than $10.  Of the sides available, I've had the green beans, chicken salad, jalapeno beans, and mustard greens.  I thought they were all very tasty!  I've only tried the spicy bbq sauce, which was also very tasty.  It was my first time for mustard greens...definitely a uniqe taste...a texture similar to spinach but a hint of sour taste....I'd have them again!  The ambiance of this place is very cool.  I love all the workwork.  It's very clean and comfortable.  The only complaint I have is regarding the beverage area.  The lids for cups are at the register and straws are by the filling station....had me hunting around for a lid the first time I was there.  The staff have all been friendly, the food is very good, the prices are good.  Overall, my experience has been very good.  I'd give 4 1/2 stars if I knew how?  Good Eats, B  Update:  I just learned that my review was filtered???  I'm not sure what's up with that, but I assure you, Yelp, that this is a legit review.  Yelp, I give you 1 star for this  LOL

bC-Qt-wuQuhpXylBfK64DQ.text: We accidently came to this place instead of Rudy's. We've never been to either but after waking in we realized Rudy's was right across the street.  But we decided to stay and try this place.  I wasn't sure what to order but I was able to try each meat before I made my decision. The hubby and I decided to go with the two meat combo,  which was $10.49 and included a drink, corn, a roll,  and two sides.  I got the tri tip and boneless pork shoulder and the hubby got the beef brisket and shredded pork. I had the loaded mashed potatoes which were tasty but a little too salty for me. The corn was really good along with my jalapeno corn bread. The meat was okay. Now I'm not much of a BBQ person but the hubby is so that's why we chose it. He loved everything on his plate (baked beans and mashed potatoes) and was done way before I took my third bite (so it seemed). He said he would eat here every week if he could.  The employees were very friendly and helpful and made our first experience there a good one.  Just not as crazy about bbq like he is but it's a good place to check out.

Olneuph3e9HYxxRgFbb1xw.text: Got this for lunch delivered one day when my car was in the shop not impressed.. If we're talking pure food quality I give it 1 star.. I got the baby back ribs which I actually paid extra for then the pork ribs and they were dry and terrible with sides of Mac and cheese and green beans with the jalapeno cornbread all awful.. Cornbread like sawdust. I'm not a picky eater but I threw most of it away. The only reason I gave 3 stars is I got the peach cobbler in order to meet the minimum delivery and that was amazing I give them that they can make a good dessert also delivery was very fast so that's a plus but I do live right across the street so that probably had a lot to do with it I definitely won't be back though

The meats were all fantastic really good flavor.  They offer regular and spicy sauce -both were very tasty.  Employee's were friendly and helpful. The sides I ordered were mashed potatoes and greens. The greens were really good ..the potatoes were so-so. Go to restaurants dot com for offers. I got the 5$ coupon so basically half off of what I ordered. Good food..large portions.

gh4gh_lwyXR7ZmzBV7bbTQ.text: I had been wanting to try this place and now regret it. Ordered take out via Uber eats and it came quickly so great on their end but the food was so sub par. If the food was better tasting and quality then maybe I would try them again but honestly, having 3 things wrong with and order and then them forgetting things was just negligence on their behalf. Train the employees better. I'll stick to Rudys and Dickeys.

l9UHdSCAOpN4TuNDmOLgOw.text: Was the worst I have ever eaten. I stopped in on a Thursday nite looking for some bbq. Upon walking in the door I noticed thier special for the day was rib tips. Since I had not had had ribs tips since the day in Chicago, I decide why not. Walked to the counter and placed my order, the  server was pleasant bu she didn't know how to cut them.on I odered a beer for my savory treat. Brought my order to my  table and within 5 minutes I was out the door. Worst Meat I have ever had tough like shoe leather and no flavor. Chuck the whole thing in the Trash as well as a half of beer. Should have gone to Rudys across the street. I you like BBQ don't waste your time here.

d6jpvQ7OzVpMzUuvndKNqA.text: We're big fans of Can't Stop Smokin' because they have some of the best BBQ in town.  That Rudy's place across the street has nothing on CSS, well, except for maybe good customer service.   We took advantage of the Groupon deal for dinner on 1/24/19.  I expected the typical walk in, wait to be served, select meats/sides, pay and get out the door within 10 minutes or so.  First of all, I think something must have happened before I walked in - perhaps the jerky manager chewed everyone out minutes before - who knows.  All I know is that the people working were frowning, quiet and moving as slow as molasses, and there was a heavy negative vibe that hung in the air which could be felt from the second you walk in.  UGH.  It took me 26 minutes to wait, select food and pay - and there were only 2 people in front of me.  The manager was right there the whole time, with his head buried in one of the cash registers trying to "help" a new girl take a catering order, much to the dismay of the 6 people waiting in line to pay.  He glanced up, demanded to one brunette employee to come over and help (to which she ignored) and looked back down again.   The only saving grace was Kayla, who apparently can do it all, from preparing the food in the back, to serving customers and cashiering.  She saw the problem and jumped in to take care of EVERYONE that the manager ignored. She was also the only one in the place who could even muster a half-smile.  Hats off to her!  Like I said, we love the food and come here regularly (even bring out-of-towners here), but this experience soured me.  We might come back and if we do, if there's even a hint of the same vibe going on when we walk in, we'll turn around and never come back.

E7rTdu9yuMVURLobIAgGbQ.text: Had them cater a party for 25. Huge hit with guests. They were amazing to deal with. Food showed up exactly when promised. We also hit the restaurant regularly. Why someone would hit Rudy's with this across the street is beyond me. Great food and service.

6Gb8j6kq9Fa3bKJp8gAoHg.text: I am giving this place a 3 star. Was my first time there. Ordering is simple. My meat was cold and chewy.  Even though I let the lady know I have a gluten allergy, she put the bun, mac and cheese on my plate. They have no clue. The place was clean but empty. No desserts for the daughter at we want there around 6.30 p.m

47bMykeJHw_17Rpgo1b4UA.text: First time to eat at Can't Stop Smokin BBQ.  Just to start off, I grew up in Kansas City where the beef bbq in my opinion is the best.  With that said I would highly recommend this restaurant.  This is some of the best bbq I have eaten in the Phoenix area.  No fries but other sides are awesome. Great friendly place and I plan to return to try some of the other offerings.  Check out the specials!!!!

zrYyGyP0e9KCdRkVwnv0fg.text: We love this place! Friendly staff, always helpful and the food is never disappointing! We always get the picnic. We are a fam of 4, a 22 year old son and a 16 year old and it's more than plenty for us. We've had everything from the brisket, which is amazing, tri-tip, turkey, pulled pork to the sausage and have never been let down. The sides are great...we love the green beans, carrots and the mac and cheese. As for dessert, you can't go wrong with any of their cobblers. It's one of our favorites!

QkWc0ilimB7n88tscLPYzA.text: First time at Can't Stop Smoking BBQ. Dropped in on a Saturday around noon. There were four people eating in this huge place. Hmm, not a good sign.   There were plenty of options so I chose them all!  I got a sampler plate (#7 on the menu) that came with pulled pork, pork ribs, brisket, sausage, two sides and choice of bread. I got Mac N Cheese plus coleslaw and a jalapeno cornbread muffin. It was $16.   The only way to break this down is to rate each item. Pulled pork: 4 stars; ribs: 5; brisket: 5, sausage: 3, Mac: 5, slaw: 5, muffin: 4. Value: 4. Nothing was 'bad' but some were more bland than others, like the sausage. The pulled pork, sausage and cornbread were about as good as what I make on my Weber at home. The rest of them were better than mine (Mac was way better!)  The atmosphere was very teen-centric, as was the cafeteria setup. Something can be said for a long line winding past a worn butcher block with a pit master working the knife and fork. None of that here.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pulled pork, pork ribs, brisket, sausage, coleslaw, Mac &#39;n cheese and a cornbread muffin for $16. Booyaahh

FtZGyddPDofcaoCebOLkxw.text: Great food at a great price.  I have taken visiting family here a couple of times, and they always rave about how good the food is.

L4AVpvaDiAY9Nm_cCa0bhA.text: Coworkers recommended this place since I would frequent the neighbor BBQ place. This place was just tasteless. Every meat we ate had no flavor. The sausages were tight like store bought sausages. (Probably is) everything was unwrapped from saran wraps. I'm use to ordering BBQ where it's taken straight off the smoker to your plate. 2 stars is rounding up and only because they offer okay sides.  Edit: I expect to smell like BBQ after visiting the said establishment. Went home and smelled no hint of it with a bland taste left in my mouth.

_obhhtECqTwB5CoUcHunfw.text: The BBQ here is awesome. We usually go to Rudy's next door which is always really busy and crowded. But we decided to try our this restaurant again because we got a good deal on a Groupon and the food was really favor filled and savory! We got a huge dish of meat with 3 different sides. We ordered the chicken breast, brisket and I forgot the other one! Some sort of beef. IT WAS SO GOOD! The service was great, everyone was really nice and polite.

vAMGcoD6gBmA4x8bejbbSQ.text: I feel like I was cheated out of meat on my sand which. When I asked, the girl working appeared to have an attitude about it.

300sSyDYTrRIwIj99wZWHw.text: We had bought a Groupon for a BBQ picnic package and since we were on that side of town yesterday we decided to go ahead and use it for takeout to bring home. Let me say -  I was really impressed! We ended up getting a pound of brisket, a pound of pulled pork, macaroni and cheese, baked beans, garlic potatoes, and peach cobbler. It also came with bread so we opted for half jalapeno cornbread and half dinner rolls. It was a good sign when we pulled up in the middle of the day and the parking lot was full of cars. Since we had Breann, our dog,  with us hubby waited in the car while I ran in to get it. The inside of the place is awesome with wood furniture and Western decor throughout. You go down the line and pick what selections you want and they build your plate while you watch.  I was really impressed with the fact that they weighed everything. So I knew that the pound of brisket or pulled pork that I received was really a full pound because I was able to view the scale when they sat each on it. The meat was very tender and not at all fatty or gristly. The smokiness was definitely evident and no sauce was even needed although I did slather it with their original sauce which had a sweetness to it that I really enjoyed. All of the sides we received were very good however I think the macaroni and cheese was my favorite! The noodles were firm and the cheese was thick and creamy, just the way I like it. The jalapeno cornbread was very good and not very spicy at all. The peach cobbler had a little tartness to it and not too sweet. Perfect for the dollop of ice cream we topped it with! I also really appreciated the fact that they wrapped everything in saran wrap individually for transport. Not only did it not make a mess in the car but it also kept in the heat so when we got all the way back to the west side of town things were still pretty warm. Everyone was very friendly and made sure to make me feel welcome. We will definitely keep this on our list of go to places whenever we find ourselves on the east side of town again.

9qC4HT22zthyjtU-sNyoYQ.text: I ordered off UberEats and got Pete's Pick and the blackberry cobbler. I ate my fill (well, a bit over) and have over half the box still for leftovers. The sausage is alright, brisket is pretty good, but the pulled pork is FANTASTIC. It tastes like camping, it has an amazing smoky taste that seriously makes me feel like I'm sitting around a campfire at night in the woods.  The mac n cheese is pretty good too, it's got a good thick homestyle consistency. The garlic potatoes are pretty good but next time I'll try something else. The blackberry cobbler... Oh man. It was so hard to put down, it was hot and fresh and delicious. I was going to give my leftovers to my boyfriend when he got home from work but he might not find out that there was cobbler if he doesn't get home soon.

QAU6S0jkY-khR3sJxBPXTQ.text: I was born in the deep south, where babies are weened from momma with BBQ. I've been devouring the stuff for 60 years now, from South GA, to Tenn, to Kansas City, to Dallas Tx, to Oakland Ca, and all points in between. So believe me when I say I know good BBQ.  I tried 'the-other-place' on 3 occasions based on reviews and just couldn't figure out what the big deal was. Finally, after a craving, I tried Can't Stop Smokin... and I was like YEA this is it.   The tell-tale sign of a good joint is the pulled pork. If they can't do pulled-pork right then that's a sign the rest is lousy as well. I thought the pulled pork was good - coupled with the regular sauce it tasted great. I didn't like the 'hotter' version of the sauce...  Went back again for a Brisket sandwich - very good, not like shoe-leather across the street.  Tonight I sampled a 1/2 rack of ribs - excellent.  This is good stuff folks - trust me, I got 60 years of experience backing up my statement.

VdiNDjsh66dvdWh6Cv3c_Q.text: Just stopped in for the first time and saw the lunch special sign.  7/1/17 BBQ sammich, drink, chips 6.99 I had the sliced brisket with spicey bbq sauce, mac n cheese and a coke. The roll was impressive along with the brisket and the sauce. A very hearty sized sammich to say the least along with a killer price!! Great job guys, i'll be back!

r2_96DvVOj__DIEipW-Tlg.text: My meal of tri-tip and two sides looked pretty epic. And sure enough it was epic -- an epic disappointment!  I have to agree with some of the other reviewers who wrote that their food lacked flavor. The mac n cheese in particular really surprised me. It was amazing how they were able to remove so much flavor from the end product. I don't know how they managed to pull it off.  The tri tip and mashed potatoes could both be described as just okay. Neither impressed, and I ended up dousing a healthy amount of bbq sauce on the meat in order to enjoy it.  You'll find much better bbq just across the street, at a little place that rhymes with Fruity's.

dp4IOYPFhT2SUyT22Bwb6A.text: Friendliest staff and amazing food!  Came here with the Groupon which was a great deal and will return again.

WBumk3bacDwFHaItmSYXeQ.text: Really good food, the combo for 6.99 plus tax was nice. I don't know why there are so many negative reviews on here, the food is great, the smoky bbq smell is delightful, I had a great first experience. Really liked the sides. Felt nore home cooked than Dickeys BBQ and the service was polite and helpful.

BRxVw_HQuPYWxOFxYXRPkA.text: I love Mom and Pop run businesses.   I was driving along Chandler Boulevard, saw the sign "Family Run Business" and decided to stop.    There is so much homogeneity in our dinning experience today. Everything is so cookie cutter.   Yet with that uniformity comes time tested (and test lab) food tastes, that makes us come back for more -- no matter which city or town we find ourselves in.   But if you are tired of the "same old, same old" as I am, you keep your eye open for these places. Don't get me wrong Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ isn't perfect, but it's a nice change.   Last night I ordered their Combo Dinner.  That's two specialty smoked meats, two sides, a soft drink and your choice of breads. I went with the Brisket, smoke polish sausage, garlic mash, apple cobbler and jalapeno corn bread for $10.99. They do the same thing for lunch at $7.99.   I found Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ "A-Okay" and Three Stars good. The meat had a nice smokey taste that lasted after my meal, while the sides were little bland and the corn bread had no kick. BTW, what's with all this 4 Sq signage? I didn't even know they were still in business. LOL
