Zy8NpfkyEEuoU_S36Cm6ww.text: Their loaded mashed potatoes are without a doubt my favorite side I order it for both my sides! I always get a chicken sandwich and I'm never disappointed, I love this place and I love that they deliver quality food on the go ugh I love it!

NLfu0-SYJV_F5XSL2pnECg.text: Very enthusiastic service, but the spicy pork bbq sandwich that I had was on the bland side, and not very flavorful. The sirloin side was much better. A co-worker had the brisket sandwich, and he really liked it.

5dfOu48IElWqIS1mfqtHfw.text: On my visit I found both staff & management very helpful in walking me through their set up & cafeteria style service. The food was very good as I had an assortment of meats with the ribs being my favorite. Generous portions of side dishes left full and satisfied making me want to go back for more. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

5lBjzP24Qvw3y8dRaHzsnw.text: My friends and I tried LSS for lunch yesterday. I give this restaurant five stars for atmosphere but only on star for food. The food was old and tired. I'm guessing the cooks prepared to much food for lunch and let it sit on the cafeteria line for dinner. We tried to eat the following: Baby back and ST louis ribs, both were dry and tasteless. The pulled pork was not editable. We saw the manager add water to the pan to breath life into the pork. It didn't work. The tri tip was over cooked. The brisket tasted like bad pot roast and it had a green tint to it. The sausage was tasteless. The corn bread muffin was so so. The Mac and cheese was bland.   Honestly we had high hopes for this restaurant but after spending $60 for three of us and dumping most of the food in the garbage, we won't be back.   My one suggestion to the manager, don't cook so much ahead of time. After the food sits out for hours really how can it be fresh and good.

BPgnskB5rLbf2-n3dFrv0w.text: My order: brisket, smoked sausage, potatoes, jalapeno beans, jalapeno corn bread, berry pie.  Total for order: just over $13.   Portions:Small (especially for a bbq place)  Sauce: Bland, typical. What you would find in a bottle in a grocery store. Even the spicy was not good at all.   The food: The brisket was a complete disaster. I did the pull test to see if it was cooked properly. A properly cooked brisket will be slightly elastic, but will pull apart when pulled. This brisket pulled apart with no give whatsoever. Overcooked. The flavor of the brisket, well, was nowhere to be found. No smoke ring, no smoke flavor, no real seasoning to be tasted. I have had better brisket made in an oven. I wonder if this brisket really spent any significant time in a smoker...   The sausage was average, nothing special at all. Again, no smoke flavor to be found.  The sides: the potatoes were good. The beans were good. Neither was amazing, but I ate them happily. The jalapeno cornbread was nasty. It lacked any taste besides jalapeno. Very bland.   Desert: The pie was actually really good. I would come here to get a whole pie in the future. I am serious, the pie here was quite good.   Comments: The staff was really nice and seemed to stand behind their food. However, their positive and welcoming attitude did not make up for the fact that this BBQ is weak. I cannot give them another chance, because for the prices they charge I cannot risk another meal of this caliber. Besides the pie, very disappointed and I would never eat here again. Too bad, their staff was really nice...

DwJoEb-UDnAgGjCC0dOQ4g.text: I would have to say the best thing about CSS is the interior.  Very well done and offers a great ambiance.  The food on the other hand was rather disappointing.  I tried the Brisket, Spare Ribs, Sausage, potato salad, mac and cheese and corn bread.  For the most part everything was pretty bland and lacked a good smoke flavor.  The brisket was moist but no ring which leads me to believe it was put on the smoker to give it some color but then was taken off and wrapped and placed in an oven.  The sausage had a good smoky color and flavor but the spices within the sausage were nothing more than you find in a store bought sausage.  My sides were overall bland and the corn bread was very dry.   I was able to try some samples from my friends meals and I would say the beef rib was very well done and tasty.  The pie was also very good.   The food is served cafeteria style which is difficult for me to get past, It lends itself to questioning how long ago the food was prepared.  Also I did not get a strong smell of smoke inside the restaurant.   Overall I think CSS would be a viable BBQ option for the area if they were not located right next to another BBQ joint.  They have stiff competition and currently are lacking in the flavor department by a long way.

qYspQeLHr2dwPfS5oRD-Qg.text: I've tried both Rudy's and Can't Stop Smoking and I think Can't Stop Smoking's food is much better over all. Rudy's pulled pork is a little better but close. CSS is less expensive and has a great ambiance and is very clean. CSS wins for me.

B2Oi-3lD69qYGy78V0E1OA.text: Used grub hub for delivery service to a hotel no more than 4 minutes away by car.   The delivery guy called me 9 minutes after the scheduled delivery time stating he was outside my room.  I opened the door and no one was there, I asked if he was at the right place.  He hung the phone up on me and showed up to my door 6 minutes later.  He was a Cant stop smoking employee (wearing company shirt), and delivered my ice tea which was spilled over, and two trays of semi warm food.  I also ordered a peach cobbler which came in a plastic cylinder container.  It was the medium size cobbler and it appeared they stuffed in the the container.  It did not resemble anything like a cobbler, instead it looked like peach barf.  Worst part about it, no silverware.  I contacted CANT STOP and they said they will deliver utensils to me.  So far it's been 14 minutes.  The food is getting colder, I am getting hungrier, and the utensils are MIA.

WiFU4n_6WK9T0BRP_4AZZQ.text: Order: Delivery  Food: Combo # 3  - Pulled Pork, Beef Tri Tip and 1 Pork Rib W/ Iced Tea  Quality: GREAT  What I didn't like:  They put Jalapeno peppers in the Corn Bread.   Overall:  The delivery was on time, portions were generous, tender, juicy and full of flavor. I will be reordering from Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ!

q8EPgGP5k0-063MaxkFr_Q.text: Yummmm!!  Finally, Chandler has some great BBQ!! Pulled pork is amazzzzing, fabulous atmosphere and customer service is the best I've seen.   Well done Can't stop! I'll be back

FAxEElzRJDcNltRw41DS3Q.text: Price is good, and thrilled with choice of wheat buns. Tea was good, and meats moist and tender. Everything could have used a little more seasoning.

7-auJmw-eGRXleGRRrS3-g.text: My wife and Daughter had dinner last night and it was great. From the moment you walk in the craftsmanship and detail of all the different wood is  amazing! Friendly staff greeting you soon as you walk in asking have you been in before explaining the menu and how to order. The smell of smoke and spices as you approach the line. Everything we got to eat had the perfect amount of smoke, most places in the area are so smoky it's hard to eat this place nails it. The sides are good, cobbler very tasty, and the sauce both options are very good. My daughter said she wants to come hear every time after gymnastics.  We will be back great job CSS!!!

lZhGQhX9e-2T8_HobB7NKw.text: Gross, gross, gross. Good if you like your brisket to taste like chemicals.

lgf4WNX5cw7C1rZ-ux49mA.text: First off, BBQ is about meat and when it comes to smokey, BBQ meat, these guys know what they are doing.  I ordered a combo plate with ribs, because when first visiting any BBQ place, always judge by the ribs.  Ribs are hard to fake, because there isn't much there.  Their ribs are divine.  They don't fall off the bone, which is a sign of overcooking, but they pull away from the bone with gentle ease, which is a mark of a great rib.  They also have the characteristic pink hue to the inner meat, which is another hallmark of proper BBQ.  Now, I'm not a big BBQ sauce person and usually prefer my BBQ with a nice dry rub, and I can't attest to their BBQ sauce, but their meat had a divine smoky quality that was an excellent complement to the baby back ribs natural pork flavor. The dry rub had a nice bit of flavorful spice to it without being more that just a suggestion of heat on the tongue.  The price seems just a tad bit on the high side, but not so that you feel like you were roughed up too much.  This is place has a sort of deli style counter that you walk up to and tell them what you want.  They sell most of their product by the pound (or fractions of), like a deli would of sliced meats, but they do have some pre-designed plates to choose from.  After you get your food, you pay at the register and either take it to go or sit in their very rustic, wood-accented dining room with a reasonable number of TVs on sports.  They have lots of drinks to add to your meal, including sweet tea, and the bottled craft beers (and other mas produced swill) were very reasonably priced. The only negative that I can point out about this place is the sides.  The greens were straight out of a can and very unremarkable and the mashed potatoes (even the loaded version) were straight out of a box (think potato buds).  While the loaded mashed potatoes were accented with some spinach, garlic, and some other flavors, it wasn't enough to hide that instant mashed potato flavor.  However, I stick to my first comment in this review, that BBQ is all about the meat and this place is right on target with that and cooked by an experienced hand.  Go for the meat, have a beer, watch some sports and enjoy!

Kq1i_ARMG1iLnBiPxvyi3Q.text: With two BBQ joints across the street from each other [the other being Rudy's] my curiosity got the best of me.  HUGE mistake!  I should have turned around and left when I saw the ribs were wrapped in plastic sitting in heating trays, along with the other menu items.  But hey, don't judge a book by its cover, right?  WRONG!  The collard greens were overcooked, and so vinegary that they were inedible.  The Mac and Cheese.....well, KRAFT does a better job.  It was watery and bland.  The Tri-Tip was way overcooked, dry and the best thing about it was the fat.  The jalapeno corn muffin was dry, brittle, and did not taste good at all.  The Baby-Back Ribs were edible, barely.  95% of this meal went into the garbage.  As I left there at 1:00pm I noticed there were only 4 other customers seated in the restaurant.  When I drove past Rudy's I could not help notice there was a line out the door.  If the meal was free I would not eat there again.

lA9CzPk5F8VnEwKx0_j8eA.text: Had baby backs, brisket, and tri-tip. Brisket was awesome; however, baby backs and tri-tip were way below average. Baby backs were too dry and not cooked slow and long enough; thus, bones would not come off easily. Very disappointing as I was looking forward to trying this place out. Tried tri-tip per employee's recommendation but it was way too dry for my liking. I can cook way better than this place in my Green Egg. If you are a fan of brisket, I would recommend this place. Otherwise, I would not go back.

e2rHKnZOqUZ6RfuF4t6Wmg.text: Can't Stop Smokin BBQ is directly across the street from Rudy's BBQ which is really good. Probably one of the best chain BBQ's here in Phx...Not sure if the folks who opened this place knew that was going in there when they opened this place. If they did, then that was a poor marketing decision. Can't Stop's  decor is kinda cool. Has a log cabin/lodge feel to it. The booth I sat in was in need of major repair to the seat cushion. All the wood blinds and light fixtures are looking like they've never seen a duster. The place was not busy and yet almost every table looked like it needed to be cleaned. The employees all seem to be college or high school kids, nothing wrong with that. They were all polite and knew their stuff. After all that, let's get to the food! My husband and I both got the lunch combo special, sandwich, chips or side dish and a drink for 6.99. Not a bad deal. Good portions. However, maybe our choices weren't the best ones. I had the spicy pulled pork... Not sure who they are catering to by calling it spicy... It was not. Their 2 sauces are average at best. My side was the spinach mashed potatoes. I could be wrong, but judging by the taste and texture, they could have easily passed as high school cafeteria boxed potatoes. My husband had the Mac and cheese. He said it was pretty much just pasta smothered in cheese whiz. I had higher hopes for this place. It has potential. Might give it a second try and come back for dinner... Stay tuned!

lBIR_k-wTtrr-QXVgQEM8w.text: Out of this world good BBQ. The meats (pulled pork & brisket) were tender and delicious. Sauce was very good. Even bought a bottle to go. Great value. We're new to the Phoenix area and have tried a number of BBQ restaurants here, and by far Can't Stop Smokin' is the best food and value! Great lunch special and selection of sides to go with your meal. Carrots, corn, potatoes & macaroni were all good.  Been here a number of times and will definitely be back. Food is awesome every time. Extremely friendly and helpful staff to boot.

3xEFP_ZsP4jaMtEj170acw.text: I order food for a crowd from Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ once or twice a year.  I get compliments on the food year after year.  The price is right, and service is excellent. I will continue to order from them for all of my events.

5qfwV_oohUNbk4bAnvDfTA.text: I ended up here by accident since my co-worker picked the place for lunch.  We had brisket and pulled pork (both by the pound).  The servings are huge and the meat is OK. The best part is the price.   Pretty decent spot if you don't have high expectations and your wallet won't suffer.  The thing that I disliked of this place is that they still use styrofoam everything. Come on, it's the 21st century and we don't need more trash to inherit to our great great grand children.  Not even the public enemy with the golden arches uses styrofoam any longer since the nineties!   Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

KoVxONjiv-WYvJ_auCfjMw.text: Caveat: my husband and I have both lived in the south, so our expectations may be a bit high.  The food was *meh*  The chicken was well done and juicy, so good job for that. The brisket was decent, better than average. The sauce tasted like sauce, the Mac and cheese doesn't look like real Mac and cheese (it was very, very orange) so I declined but the potatoes were good.   One point I'd also like to mention is that the staff doesn't wear hair nets. I normally wouldn't notice this until my husband pulled a 6-8 inch blondish hair from his mouth as he was eating his peach cobbler.   Neither one of us have blondish hair.   They resolved the matter quickly, refunding the price of the cobbler, and apologizing immediately so no concerns about customer service but yeah, that was kind of gross.  I won't hold that against a place forever, but I don't think we'll be back...

zYtcJN0jk2GWSHLk8Q3h9g.text: Food was amazing! We ordered a nice sized order for pick up, it was ready when I got there! All I had to do was throw it in the oven to keep it warm. Everyone raved over how good the brisket and ribs were, our order came with cherry pies that were as equally good! Thank You

IbmQ-OayROEUFwFURkDjQg.text: First time here. Liked the atmosphere...family friendly and warm ambiance. Ample seating. Ordered the beef brisket in one combo and the brisket and chicken breast in the other. The brisket was great!! Chicken was good but nothing to swoon over. Loved the 2 choices of BBQ sauce. Sides were ok. Maybe the temperatures were a bit on the cool side, thus reducing my enjoyment. I like my food to be served hot.  The meat was the winner for sure! We will be back :)

01DtCxvPb4h-ZEawTsbXqA.text: We used Can't stop smokin for our 160 guest wedding. They did an amazing job and the food was to die for. We mostly talked with the owner Peter throughout the process for menu options and payments. He made it very easy on us and was pleasant to work with.

88j-sMlIINhioATaCnkaWw.text: This has got to be my most favorite BBQ resturaunt in town! Their food is absolutely to die for! Their ribs, steaks, and meats are cooked well and are well seasoned. Their service is excellent. The music is classic but enjoyable. If you dont mind getting your fingers dirty, then I suggest you dine here! They have utensils inside if you suggest to avoid sticky fingers.

1huadiXuOxkt-iHUfTYGhA.text: In the turf war that is the Chandler Blvd BBQ battle, this place has somethings going for it.  First, the service was fast and the restaurant was clean.  The value was good too.  Most of the meats range in the $10-$13/lb range which is fair.  They have a lot of different combos for you to choose from as well.    In terms of the food, there were some ups and downs.  The smoked sausage was really good as were the jalepeno beans.  The brisket was overdone but still pretty tasty.  I look forward to trying it again when it's hopefully having a better day.  The spareribs were also overdone and not very good.  I liked the pulled pork though, it had a nice consistency and flavor to it.  Even with the meats that weren't great they were saved by some really good sauces.  Sauce should be used sparingly but the spicy variety was hard not to chug.  You could put that on a piece of cardboard and it'd be good.  Not the best BBQ but pretty decent.  I'll be back for a quick lunch from time to time.

3dEClKcSB-lo-ePwpoE49Q.text: After reading several positive reviews and being a Rudy's fan, decided this trip was time to shake it up.  Boy were we really disappointed.  Never again will we come back here.  You want great BBQ go to Rudy's.  If you're looking for watered downed, perfume enhanced meat then this place is for you. (I should have known right off the bat that this place was horrible...there was no smoker to be found!)   Ordered half chicken, with garlic mashed and gravy, carrots, jalapeno biscuit and apple cobbler.  Chicken was horrible.  Tasted as if it was boiled and then thrown in a rotisserie and smoke flavoring sprayed on for that "authentic" BBQ taste.  Total Fail! Sides were definitely on par with a elementary school cafeteria.  The cobbler was a joke.  Doughy, weird non apple flavor.  The biscuit would be better served as a door stop.  Wife had pulled pork sliders and a side of green beans.  She enjoyed the sliders, although the pork was juicy it too had an off taste.  The green beans were horrible and mixed with tomatoes (we think) and remained uneaten.  Even the so called sauce was bad.  No spicy and watered down "spicy" sauce and super sweet "classic" were True disappointments.  Never in my life have I demanded a refund until today. Only got half back, better than nothing I guess.  Final sad piece is they were completely out of tea and the guy going around "cleaning up" picked up a few trays and completely ignored the water spilled near the entrance.  After making several attempts to have them clean up the water, someone finally showed up to do a quick mop up.  There's more water on the floor then before mopping.  The only good thing I can say about this place is that their pickles on the condiment bar are pretty tasty...good crunch.   Such a waste of time and money. Going next door to get some good eating and perhaps some tea.  Avoid this place at all costs!!! Epic and utter failure!!!

sf-IoGYmZ-Cdr42skVA70g.text: Stopped here to try their BBQ was very disappointed.  Sampled several pieces but the quality of the beef was low.  All cuts very tough.  The sides were bland and needed seasoning.  Then the cashiers tried to over charge.  Our total was $40 gave them a $100 only wanted to give me $40 back.  And they had no clue how to count money back.  Sorry we didn't just go to Rudy's across the street.

Fp-gzuUkDn3KPwsIoLnqXQ.text: Don't know... the sign says they open at 10:30. I walked in at 10:31, door was open. I drove from Avondale. Waited at the counter even went and used the restroom... no one to greet me. Waited for 15 minutes. No one came to the front to greet me. I finally left. I'm glad to know they gave enough business that they don't need mine.

RoUMP3UMAw-Vxdho17aosQ.text: BEST BBQ I had since I left Fort Worth! Great Food! Great Portions! We get two meals there for thirty five and me and my wife eat for two days! I have lived all over and I'm telling you this is the best I had in Arizona! I tried the trendy place across the street and its cute but the FOOD at Can't Stop Smok'in is how its supposed to be for BBQ! The sweet and spicy sauces are both great but those RIBS are so good you dont need anyything on them! The Sausage is GREAT!  Get those Baked Beans! Peach and Blackberry COBBLER!  my mouth is watering thinking about it.  Order at the bar and carry it to your table like REAL BBQ! Call for carry-out and it's ready when you get there.

-KWs81l98WCanbpq-u-OVQ.text: Good deal! Great BBQ! I like it better than Rudy's I will be back! I did the Groupon deal! Lots of food. The brisket was great

n1KVvvaEotKqiGt9TNmn4A.text: Will definitely be back! Phenomenal pulled pork, awesome seasoning on the potatoes, and the cornbread was right on point. Friendly staff, very helpful with my mother's questions. Will be my go to BBQ spot from now on!

8vLgd-_vBjOobTxJoPErSQ.text: Thoroughly mediocre BBQ and food, don't know how they stay in business in this market. The jalapeno biscuits smelled and tasted like old dryer lint, the sausage link tasted like a bland kosher hot dog (I actually threw half of it into the trash), the portions are tiny, the mac n cheese is completely tasteless. Velveeta would have been better than this mess. I mean no cheese whatsoever. I won't eat here again. Guess I've been spoiled by too many awesome BBQ spots like Yazoo in Denver, and places in the South, in Texas, and in Memphis too numerous to list.  The presentation and decor are great-- I'll give them that, but it's all form and no substance. Fancy digs aren't enough-- you have to serve good food as well. Don't waste your time and money at this place.

Iu2cAoIrzX0I1690-F6kEQ.text: love it!  We got the brisket for christmas eve and it was awesome.  we also got the pulled pork and it was very very good as well.  I think that their sauce is good -better than rudy's.

tG6BYoCH23SgPNCCWu-8Yw.text: This place is awesome, the sauce is the best bbq sauce we've tasted.  We live in east mesa and drive 30 minutes to eat here, they also have amazing huge smoked turkey legs which we always get 2-3 to take home.  The staff is super friendly.

SnSPT342XDATFEmOemHIQA.text: This place sucks ass, I would not of ate as much of the food if I didn't pay $17 for it. This is not bar-b-que, all they food is nasty. Baked beans taste like pinto beans baked in ketchup and that's being generous. Brisket taste like burned paper bag. FUCK THIS PLACE..

H07XUzw00u8tGcjwz-bEPw.text: I love this place.. so as a treat I ordered 1 beef rib! Now at 13 dollars a pound, I thought about 8 ounces, what I got was 1.5 pounds in one rib!! I was WOWD!  a brontasaurus leg for sure.  I ate 2 small bites and will take rest home!!  As usual BBQ was outstanding!

FCiarMKZMXb6Yggg84EcNQ.text: Friendly staff, place was clean, wasn't a big fan of the bbq. Rudys across the street does it better imo.

587QbFax3ZcTPE8V8JjGnw.text: The workers are suuuuuper accommodating and knowledgable about the menu but let's be real, the food is super greasy and served in what seems like a shit load of melted butter . It's really not as appetizing as it sounds. Yes butter is amazing but I'm not a huge fan of soggy food .      The floors were really sick, yuck !  The hot BBQ sauce is amaaaaazing though!  I would go back just for that. Everything else is whateva

rAJKZiTJipivkifHeEJ5iw.text: not sure what it tastes like since we were unable to purchase any, they were out of meat at 2 in the afternoon on Saturday. I called to place an order for 4 lbs. of chicken and 1lb. of brisket and was told to use online, they don't do phone orders. Tried online and placed the order but there was no option to pay cash so, we went to the business at Chandler and 56th st to get the food where we were told they were out of chicken and brisket at the time.... What the *&^% are they doing? Why not tell me that when we were talking on the phone? Needless to say, we went elsewhere, Honey Bears. The Honey Bears food and sauce was amazing, as always. A little far but worth it. We'll just say NO to Can't stop smokin

47YjA7Zu7kqaBOiFfad41w.text: They're pretty tasty. The spinach garlic potatoes is very delicious. I really enjoyed the sausages along with the beef. I will most likely return to eat here again.

1uivrpT5qLMpvL6GbIE-3w.text: Items Ordered: 1/2 lb brisket, 1/2 lb turkey, 1 lb beef short rib, 1 sausage, 2 sides.  Total Bill:  $37 after 20% Yelp check in offer.  Admittedly Little Miss BBQ has ruined our life when it comes to eating any other BBQ food.  Nothing at all compares.  But since LMB is not open Sundays, Mondays or past 4pm, the search continues for an alternative.  This spot was okay.  Not amazing but not bad.  The location was very very clean and newer and the staff was very  friendly.  Its only took us about 10 minutes to order, pick up and leave.  The only thing we would not recommend again is the beef ribs.  They were very tough and thats something you expect to fall apart and just melt in your mouth.  Everything else would satisfy a healthy appetite.

8iJ_EhMSo9SGPsOhTg-HYA.text: I made a trip to Phoenix and stayed in Chandler for 3 nights across the street from this BBQ spot.  We had dinner there after the Arizona Cardinal football game.  I had the briskett and smoked turkey.    The briskett was scraps and the smoked turkey as so dry that even bbq sauce could not help it.  It was so far done it changed colors.  Definitely stay away and maybe try the BBQ next door.

ByN3aKgL_icmqtR0XaGhNw.text: I feel bad writing this review because the staff has been very friendly and helpful. However, this place has the worst tasting bbq I've ever had. We have come a lot because my wife bought a lot of groupons for it. I was so happy when our final Groupon was used up. During our visits I tried to sample everything in hopes that we would like something but sadly that never happened. I take that back...the Apple cobbler dessert is very good. But other than that youre much better off going to Rudys. This place is depressing, check out my pic of the sad dessert display.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Saddest dessert display ever.

rZjpK8UUQb5WEGLzDYwdKA.text: I have eaten here a few times but visited this evening and was terribly disappointed.  Usually the food is great and the portion sizes are decent. Tonight not so much. The guy that prepared my order seemed to believe that he was preparing a child's plate. I reminded him that I am an adult. He continued with the frugal portions. As stated, I've been here several times before and this was the smallest serving I have ever had!  My order was for takeout and when I got home I found that the guy put the bread in with the meat and it was a smushy mess!  I could not eat the bread as it was slimy and soaked in the juices from the meat. Never thought to ask him to separate the bread as in prior visits the bread was always wrapped separate from the rest of the meal.  I am very disappointed with the outcome of my visit. Had this been my first visit, this would have also been my last visit.  However, I know that this restaurant can do better so I will give them another chance. My rating is based on overall.  If it was based solely on tonight's visit, I would give only 1 star.

1fleJm7NwkhOfcrojtP0jQ.text: Nothing wrong here! This is BBQ at its best!! Not sure why the place across the street (Rudys) was packed. There was a long line and long picnic tables so I came here instead. Boy am I glad I did!  I ordered the #5 Petes pick which is their sampler platter. Brisket - awesome and falling apart! Pulled pork - delicious! Hot links - great! And the pork spare ribs - perfect! Cole slaw, corn cobbette and jalapeno cornbread rounded out the sides. This just set me back $16 with drink!  Maybe I don't understand what's going on here? Or maybe the people of the Phoenix area don't? Either way, they're the ones missing out on this gem of the BBQ world!  I highly recommend this place to other BBQ snobs!!

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. #5 Petes Pick continued...
Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. #5 Petes Pick

iQJY6GiKI2RZn-RtuHzSgQ.text: It was ok... bbq places are getting way too expensive for cheap meat. Nice people but I have to say not worth the price. I'm from Texas and one thing we do well is BBQ. Also portion sizes are like kids sizes. If you going to charge high prices have premium quality meat.. LOOK UP ten50 bbq, Smokey joes etc in Texas. Still great people though!!

ziW7R_0S0Cmr1n2ES_GZzw.text: Although I didn't visit their main location, this satellite location was welcoming. The decor was simple but charming and above all else, the BBQ was legit. There are many things that can help certain types of restaurants overcome so-so food, but BBQ has to be the real deal. This place had that covered and had no need to add bells and whistles. I'm eager to check out the main store soon.

tC_2XWZFqO7ol2ZgucHO-g.text: Whenever we're in town we like to try new restaurants and chains we don't have in the greater Chicago area. I'm happy I chose Can't Stop Smokin BBQ! I had the brisket, pulled pork, Mac and cheese, & potato salad. Everything was absolutely delicious, everything was clean and staff was friendly. Can't wait to stop in next August!

e4TIg40B85OJKjwYQGK32Q.text: Darn!  I wanted to love the food here.  The restaurant is casual and cool.  The service was good and fast.  The price was fair.  The bbq meats were really good but every side dish I tried was not good.  Have you ever had bad Mac and cheese?  I did tonight.  There was no flavor what so ever.  The green beans were from a can.  And even the corn bread muffin was not great.  Too bad.  I hope the owners read this and make some tweaks to their side dish recipes.  Good Mac and cheese is so easy too make.  You just need to use real cheese instead of processed cheese.

p0jj5S3NZAYpi2H2BtFFZg.text: I was very disappointed today after trying this place for the first time.  We have always heard that they were really good.  Here are the reasons why for my dissatisfaction:  1.) A LOT of fat was on the meat.  I was charged by the pound, however I could only eat 1/2 the meat because the other 1/2 was fat.  2.) The cobbler was dry, very little fruit and way too much crust and sugar.  3.). The mashed potatoes had very little flavor and you could tell they were an instant mix.  4.) The staff was less than thrilled and seemed like you were bothering them as the served you through what I would call your basic chow hall line.  God forbid you would ask them a question that would require an answer that took more then two words.  I would have to say I have had better food at the hospital after having surgery.    Never again!

0_R1px6PHtwRTyphNo4sHQ.text: O.M.GOSH!! Eat here!  I didn't read the other reviews before going in (which is something I normally do). And, I am glad I didn't! 3.5 stars?? WTH??  I got a sweet a** Groupon deal. It was like $28 for a picnic basket (usually $45-$50).  So, we were eating there regardless!  Glad we did!  The food was DELISH and they have shopping bags of dog bones for $5! 5 freaking dollars!  My kids tore up that sausage, and as a coleslaw lover... Freaking amazing!!  The only thing I didn't like... Warm up those rolls, folks!!  I don't know these people, I just love food. And, their food is delish!  (Opened a location in Mesa, recently)

_XlEcRalPfE4MNOUSxe2gQ.text: Love this spot for lunch time bbq , the brisket is so tasty and yummy . Try the spicy bbq sauce has a great zip to it:)

wN6yJYsQwTBy6KJZAL7l-w.text: Great food - great care and preparation in what they serve - smoked wings are phenomenal- Cole slaw fresh and cobblers are heaven - I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a home cooked BBQ meal!

DTGeQsM1J9tolo1wr-By4w.text: With the groupon it's a wonderful deal. We go often. I found the Ahwatukee location to be much better than the Mesa simply because of the customer turnover. When the meat is in a steam table if there are no customers the food gets dry. Great place to take another couple out and share.

vTqSzbognbmRCjuc9sPHHw.text: Quick bbq stop Food was okay you could tell it was sitting A bit dry and veggies a bit mushy Okay joint if your trying to get in and out.

8qgeqfDphRLN3nLzINLN8w.text: firstly, don't go here anytime near closing. went about 20 plus minutes before for a super quick take out (items are already cooked, just need to be placed in a container). people were still there eating, so not like the place was just empty. so,... let's just say i was ignored for about 5+ minutes first. (1st time there, was standing in the wrong area) finally, figured it out and tried to be really quick. between, all the constant sighing and loads of dropping of metal pans and utensils; i was a little uncomfortable. oh, and the annoyed blank faces... made me feel so welcome.   now,... the food was just kinda basic. i've had worst and i've definitely had better. brisket was kinda okay-ish; would order again if returned (somehow). now,... the cobbler dessert was pretty good (would return just for this). everything else was just kinda meh... no real distinct flavor profile and the same with the sauce just...MEH!   so in closing,... i would just say that, if i was a bbq place that was right next to a bbq place (another restaurant is across the street) with food that was meh (for the most part); i might have a bit better customer service (at all times), since people like me might just eat next door. customer service is so much more that meh food and sometimes even good food.

lBW49Uuyz-wxa1Ib3iqXlA.text: Not many people here for lunch during the week.  The tri-tip was good but not great.  The mac and cheese was okay.  I prefer Rudy's though I did like the booths!

eXTcGG6Q7mJZcUkL5qhzZQ.text: Excellent service. Great prices and specials. The ribs the brisket everything is outstanding. I love this place.

-GQAtLm0kp7mL2kOuXa4lg.text: I hate to do this. What's worse, after this I have to write a similar review for Andrew's Barbeque, which I visited a few days prior. But really, the barbeque scene in Phoenix has improved over the years and places need to step up their game to succeed.  Most barbeque fans know that Rudy's opened in Chandeler near I-10. The week they opened we excitedly piled in the car and headed down to try it. I noticed this place then. It was about ready to open and I thought to myself, "building a bbq place right next door to Rudy's is either the dumbest thing I have ever seen, or the most brilliant.' Think about it, if a place has good barbeque they could easily steal away some of Rudy's business. Rudy's is, after all, known for its extremely long lines and wait times.   The reality is Can't Stop Smokin's just does not taste very good. Bland. No flavor. Their sauces are not even that good. I did like the collard greens, but the rest was about what you would expect if you bought barbeque at a supermarket. I had Pete;s Pick, which includes pulled pork, beef brisket, hot links, and ribs, so I got to hit all of the main items. Maybe I just tried them at a bad time?  Service was decent. The place is clean and bright. Lines are not long usually, since everyone is next door at Rudy's. The only thing wrong is the food is not great. But in a restaurant, that is a pretty important factor.

KTaAL4JpT3YILqwVhMmRfA.text: I really like the BBQ food here I think the location is kind of strange just because Rudy's is right next door to them and they seem to get better / more business than Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ. But I've tried both places and both are pretty good. They have great BBQ sauce!! (The macaroni and cheese is my favorite).

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

PFsC4wZTgJIKaoUoyjiXrg.text: We were anxious to try this place since its next door to Rudys. Neither are outstanding but I prefer Rudys better. At Rudys the service is better and the food is seasoned great and has a good smoke flavor. At CSS the cafeteria style doesn't do it for me, I feel like I am 90 years old carrying a tray and looking at dried out meat that has been sitting out for hours. I got the brisket sandwich and it was terrible, it was SO dry. My husband makes amazing BBQ and we were actually amazed that a place could serve BBQ this terrible. I could barely choke it down.   The sides tasted like something my grandma would get at her retirement community, no flavor and completely bland.   The people behind the counter remind me of Jersey Shore idiots they can barely communicate what they are trying to tell you.    The worst part is EVERY great BBQ place must have good sweet tea. Rudys sweet tea is amazing - Cant Stop's sweet tea tastes like it had been sitting in its container for 3 weeks. It was the worst tea I have ever had. The only thing good there is the cobbler. At least someone making the desserts knows what they are doing. Lets just say I wish I would have kept my $30 and not wasted my time. At the end of our meal, I was still starving and angry that we threw 90 percent of our food in the trash can.  I made my husband walk over to Rudys - and get me a sweet tea and some prime rib to go. I felt like I should treat myself to some decent meat since I just wasted time and money on CSS. We will never be back and I will not recommend this place to anyone.

vT2DBC4MIO15jXbrqDYLbw.text: Love this place!  The staff is always friendly and the food is always on point! ! Desserts taste like my mom's!  This BBQ is something to be reckoned with!

FWnCZFFRv9WzunqGVD2MeA.text: Tasty food, overall nice atmosphere, tables may be a little sticky--use lots of napkins!

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

_zClbEmDthg8YcMIkMhfDg.text: I was really looking forward to this place opening and hoped it would be good but now I'm trying to decide between one and two stars. I think two stars would lead people to believe there's something worth going here for. I've been to the one in Ruidoso and I remember it being a fair bit better. Nothing I've had here really has much flavor. If this is what these guys consider quality BBQ, they either don't have taste buds or have never had real BBQ.  The mac & cheese was horrendous. I'll normally put up with weak mac & cheese but this stuff makes Kraft seem gourmet and flavorful.   The corn is waterlogged and literally had no flavor.   You can get better sausage from the old lady giving out lunch samples at Sam's Club.  The tri-tip didn't have any flavor. I expected some kind of spice or beef flavor...or I don't know...maybe some smoke since they claim they can't stop smokin'. It just wasn't good.   Save your money and go somewhere else.

JTgI-TVfLfYxlPLHNRNHWA.text: I enjoy this place better than Rudy's across the street. The service was friendlier, price was better, and my family approved of the food options. Having to choose local BBQ - this is the place we'll be going to.

qyC8JPP8NmPsd9mpn-Wz6g.text: Anyone who likes Can't Stop Smokin' doesn't know BBQ. These people are a chain style BBQ joint that is meant to cater to people just wanting to eat out, not anyone looking for good Q.   The brisket only has flavor on one edge. They don't prep it so the flavor goes throughout the meat and it sits there precut so it can dry out while it's waiting on you to order it. That's a basic failure in serving this type of food. The sausage is store bought and sits around in a stack waiting for you to order it.   The sides are basic. Dried corn on the cob, macaroni and cheese with processed cheese (think Kraft with premade "cheese" in the box with an aftertaste) and the baked beans taste like canned beans with pepper added. The cornbread is God-awful. It's almost as dense as iron and has a really bad taste.   I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Even the Arizona Dickie's style BBQ joint is better than this. That, and there is a Ruby's literally just across the street. It's good, and head and shoulders better than this place that won't last long against its neighbor.

sQBmW8ddEJ28WdaV7DHp4w.text: I don't know why anyone would go to Rudy's across the street because can't stop smokin kicks it's butt. By far the best brisket in town. The pulled pork, carnitas and turkey are also worth the trip. Don't go to Rudy's, come here instead!

h44XqPJ2qn6Uh_fcyRg1Xw.text: Two stars, the second only because my boyfriend says a one star should only be used if the food is inedible swill.  This was fairly close.  Items ordered: Brisket- dry, tough and flavorless. Beef short rib-dry, tough, flavorless. Carnitas-very fatty, dry, flavorless. Sausage-flavorless. Jalepeno cornbread-dry, flavorless. I have never seen the boyfriend abandon a piece of cornbread and tonight he did after one bite. Baked beans-nothing to write home about per the man, I could not bring myself to taste them. Coleslaw-bland and dry, I have no idea how you can make coleslaw dry but these guys figured it out. Corn-no one bothered to taste this. Garlic potatoes-the only side that had flavor. Macaroni and cheese-bland. Yeast rolls- these were actually fairly good as well. BBQ sauce-this was good too, get plenty as you will need it.  None of the meats had a smoky flavor or any flavor at all. I'm sad. This was a waste of $36, I'm still hungry. At least the pups ate like kings tonight.

5-no2p8sx4bpVGqPGHE0kw.text: Very very good food. VERY reasonably priced! Super nice workers! We had the tri-tip, carnitas, sausage, pulled pork... ALL delicious. Wednesday night special is all you can eat ribs, which also was great. Highly recommend

DosMpBzlkIf1H0XqZ3K-tA.text: It's hard to review Can't Stop Smoking BBQ without referencing Rudy's BBQ right across the street.  I give Rudy's the edge on atmosphere, and the meats themselves were juicier and a little more flavorful... but EVERY other possible advantage goes to Can't Stop Smoking (CSS).  The sides, sauces, portions, value, variety, healthiness, accessibility, etc all favor CSS.  Upon entering, you grab an impressively heavy aluminum tray and go through a cafeteria line acquiring sliced meats.  I got a 2-meat combo, with a half-ear of corn, 2 sides, cornbread muffin, and a drink for $10.  (They also email coupons and have a stamp card.... which knocked the price down closer to $7.)  The turkey and brisket were both super lean, which I happen to like, even though that made them somewhat dry.  The turkey had a nice smokey flavor, but the dry rub on the brisket was uneven and overly salty/spicy in some bites.  No big deal because I enjoyed both the standard and spicy BBQ sauce options much better than the sauce at Rudy's.  The muffin and mac & cheese were both above average.  Amazingly, the corn wasn't totally overcooked like at most places, but I discovered that I hate mustard greens and had wasted one of my choices of sides.  Some of my friends ordered the ribs and said that was the best thing on the menu.  So where does that leave us?  Is it possible that I like the meat better at Rudy's and still like CSS better?  Yes, I think so.  I didn't have to wait in a huge line, struggle to find a table, or slice huge hunks of fat off my brisket.  (I also didn't feel gross when I left.)  I was able to order a combo, instead of "decoding" the menu to determine how much meat to order for my Wonderbread.  Can't Stop Smoking is a more commercial, more conventional experience than Rudy's, but I liked it.

hZnXxkaDW-dZyttJsRY9aQ.text: This place opened up right next to another BBQ joint.  Bad for them, good for me!    First off, it is cafeteria style. That means you don't wait to eat. You go to the counter, point at what you want, and voila! In BBQ Heaven!  This isn't the BEST BBQ I have ever had. But for the money you would be hard pressed to find a better value. I didn't try any of the sandwiches, IMO if you're going to a BBQ place for a sandwich you're wasting your time. I tried the brisket, carnitas, baked beans, mac and cheese, corn bread, corn, and iced tea. All that for $10.  Brisket was good, would have preferred a little more moist, but that's a personal preference. Carnitas were perfect. Beans and the Jalapeno Cornbread, and corn were great. Mac was lacking a little in the flavor department.   I'll definitely be back again, especially since I've only had a small portion of what the menu has to offer.

RyPbKQx5eqHxuG8MQeivrQ.text: To be fair, I did not plan on eating at Can't Stop Smoking BBQ but did not want to wait in line at Rudy's BBQ. Here is my review.  First, why open a restaurant with a competing vision and style? Rudy's and Can't Stop Smoking both do the bbq niche with a cafeteria style service, which I am not a big fan of.  The staff was o.k. but when I said something about bbq places in phoenix she said some retort about only one or two "real" bbq joints in town..Seriously I'm not a foodie just hungry and want to eat.  The staff behind the counter were incredibly helpful when it came to meal choices and they were friendlier than the waitstaff.  I ordered the 1/2 chicken combo.  The chicken was well cooked and tasty, liked that there was no sauce so I could put as much or not as I wanted later. The jalapeno cornbread muffin was stale and bland.  I had the mac n cheese and garlic potatoes for sides..Not very tasteful and not warm enough! I could have made better macaroni and cheese at home, seriously.  I probably wouldn't set foot in this establishment again until the food gets hot and service gets better.  I should have listened to my instincts and gone to Famous Daves instead, hell Boston market would have been a better choice..

iy14lh_-w2TXzDtYDfw8MA.text: Just had lunch there.  EVERYTHING I had was really good.  The carnitas were wonderful!  The sausage had great flavor.  TriTip could have used a little more flavor (dry rub), but all in all it was good.  Baby back ribs are really good too.  A little smaller than I would like, but they were all meat and no fat (huge plus).  Tried a couple of sides and they were all very good too.  I WILL be going back.  They have a large menu, so there is something for everyone on it.  Home run for me was on the way out of the restaurant...they have a small table setup with wooden tokens.  You take one token and put it into one of three bowls.  Each bowl represents a different charity.  They take a percentage from the meal that you just bought and donate it to the charity.  What a great idea.  Not only are you getting some good BBQ, but you are also helping a charity out.

6AwEOn1lPblxlCEVgOc7aQ.text: While the service was good, and everyone seemed friendly, the food was below average. I had their brisket sandwich, and the meat was about the only good thing on my plate. The bun was made for a cafeteria, and the sides (Mac and cheese + greens) just didn't have a whole lot of "love" in them. Felt like everything was just kind of thrown together and shoved in your face. BBQ sauce was average. Pricing was very good for BBQ, but you get what you pay for.

xaOBvsDA9NPQNaBNSQ_18Q.text: I really liked the BBQ here.  The first time there I had brisket and carnitas, no sides.  The meat was great.  The next time I had baby back pork ribs.  Again, great stuff.  I liked the veggies at the condiment bar. My friends said that the potatoes were fake tasting.  The rest of the sides looked sad.  My friends liked the cobbler.

ODGvvvci50F0ZkR32URlUw.text: I've ate here a couple times and it was ok. The last and I do mean LAST was terrible. 90% fat and I was not served the food I asked for. Service was horrible.

Yh2Oa9mNFEas0VAgJnleKg.text: Everyone was so friendly. Decent quality and generously portioned sirloin tri tip combo....excellent value! Found out they smoke T-Day turkeys too. Will be back more often.

gs23E8ZE4JV6rl1Dhq4Tgw.text: Love this place and the food is great. I always get the pulled pork sandwich meal with potato salad and beans. The cobbler is fantastic too. Tonight proved to be a other great experience. I love that they have restaurant.com vouchers too.

fZ6m4cUJDUBKe2fc3T8-lg.text: This place eats, sleeps and breaths BBQ. CAN'T STOP SMOKIN' is Awesome.... I've had their feasts (a tremendous value), I've had different meals, and I've been there 15 - 20 times - NEVER had a bad experience.   I see some of the other lower rated reviews and I have to wonder... There's a Rudy's literally right next door... and they are absolutely disgusting. I went there twice and you'll never find me there again. So I have to wonder if these people with the lower scores actually know where they ate. Everyone's entitled to their opinion but I'd hate to see Can't Stop Smokin' get punished for Rudy's terrible food.

6KzqjmdUoDi8Cq8FDkN3ig.text: Fantastic BBQ, we had the brisket, tri tip and sausage. All of it was delicious. Sides corn on the cob was nice and sweet, macaroni salad is perfect. I can't speak for the other cobblers but the apple cobbler was really good.

JsO5AAZ53W2WbrIBvNgTRw.text: Drove by this place and turned around cause I love bbq and just had to try. I was welcomed as soon as I came in and explained how they served. Staff was friendly and very welcoming.  Just let me say it was worth stop. I had sausage, tri tip, rib and their mac and cheese. Smoke was just enough  and the meat was flavorful and juicy. A definite must try. Definitely coming back.

0ikgbWYGOmC3Va29S-O3AA.text: So we bought the Groupon for $30.  The pork ribs are fantastic.  We received one pound of brisket which was a prime rib consistency.  I think it is the best brisket I have ever had.  The sides are all one pound containers and are great.  The give about a pound of cobbler for dessert and it is great.  Corn bread too.  So my college age son and I have big appetites.  We are bringing more than half the food home.

TczTJ6owLz9uARe74HOrzA.text: Being next to Rudy's you can get lured in by pretty curb appeal but we gave this place a try and were pleasantly surprised. Highly recommend the carnitas, sausage, garlic mashed taters, Mac and cheese and corn cob. Will definitely be back!

Z7SS1LZNx62SEGWMEI07Ig.text: The sides I didn't care for but the ribs were excellent. In fact after eating them and washing my hands, my fingers still had a faint smell of smoked meat. The meat is very good. I wish the BBQ sauce was thicker or more "authentic"  and unique, but that's a personal opinion and it comes on the side so you can chose to use it or not. I would recommend the meat and the cookies here, and to order online.

vJsGdTkPUjGjYKkrmppOAQ.text: I saw their deal on Groupon, and had to give them a try. Very friendly workers, and very good meats! I picked up a picnic pack to go to feed 6 (it's advertised to feed 4, but we fed 6 with just a little bit left over). They wrapped everything well and the food was still hot after a 20 minute commute home. The brisket was cooked excellently with a good smoke flavor, and the carnitas very very tasty. The gravy was spicy but I liked it. Barbecue sauces were tasty. I'll be back, and this will likely be my choice for where to go for my birthday meal.

5_2B1YIjOHcekZN1XT6Myw.text: Only ordered brisket and turkey. brisket was awesome second only to Franklins in Austin tx.  Moist tender good bark would have given 5 stars but portions on the small side still good

4xXST4BBm0caYmr8HOMx0w.text: Being from Texas I know a thing or two about smoked barbecue. This place is great! I ordered the #2 combo that included a meat choice, 2 sides, a bread (jalapeno cornbread for me) and a drink for $8.99. Now that's a deal! The sliced brisket was moist and lean and had a nice smoke ring. Mustard greens and new potatoes needed a little salt, but that's a taste preference. This is cafeteria style service which is quick. I can't get over the wide selection of meats and sides compared to the place right across the street. In fact, this may be my go-to bbq place when I'm in the area.

pmG2aG4MBk0qyNjLKdQmBg.text: Worst BBQ I've ever had. Ever. I ordered the carnitas and pulled pork, side of mashed potatoes/gravy and steamed carrots. The meat was cold, snappy, and bland-even with bbq sauce. The mashed potatoes were like concrete with flavorless gravy. The cobbler and carrots were the best thing on my plate. To top off the experience, the cashier was incredibly rude. I won't be back. The $2.50 bottles of beer were the best part of my experience. Do your self a favor and don't bother with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Gross cold pulled pork, carnitas, and mashed potatoes.

LE1BVHqRMJiFyOd54eqeiw.text: This Texan says never again. I requested lean brisket- it had more fat than regular brisket from other places. The taste was good but not great. The beans, corn, and garlic potatoes were also good but nothing special. The jalapeno cornbread was too dense and bland. To finish things off, I had peach cobbler...the.worst.ever. I actually spit it out. - never going here again.

FA6GWnuA9cYygAweixQP9g.text: I was always curios how this business survived when all of the customers are across the street at Rudy's. I bought a Groupon to try it out. For what I got in food, (reg $50+ for $20 with Groupon) we could have got SO MUCH MORE at Rudy's. The beans don't hold a candle to Rudy's and they don't give you any bread!  They are super picky about not giving you any amount over the 2 lbs of meat since the guy took the meat and trimmed off a piece the size of about 4 postage stamps. Rudy's would have not done that!  The meat was good, but not near as good as Rudy's. The mashed potatoes and gravy have a flavor that don't even go with the BBQ. I would encourage them to drop prices, include bread and improve the food of they truly want to compete.

6txa8BS5DQUW1NSN4q8hrw.text: I went on a Wednesday at lunch the pulled pork was very dry and the peach cobbler was mostly half burned crust with only one slice of peach. I won't go back

KxWCA6774Wjx9CDeY2407g.text: I love BBQ. I come from a long line of wannabe pit masters and know a little something, something about Q. This place is horrible and by far the worst BBQ  I have ever had. The ribs were wrapped in plastic wrap, brisket was floating in water, carnitas was tasteless, the sausage I have definitely had before but couldn't put the brand name to it and the beans tasted like good ole pork n beans dressed up. The staff was courteous and friendly but after eating here I understand now why the crowd is across the street at Rudy's. That is where I will continue to go if I'm craving BBQ after a long day of work. Don't waste your money or your time go across the street!

e2Kx5WYrhlhApRJJpHVjJQ.text: I came here because I bought a Groupon, and found a new favorite BBQ spot. First, the food. Excellent favors, great colors, moist, juicy, everything you want from good BBQ. We had brisket and pulled pork. The warm sauces were delicious. The sides were above average (ok, the beans could be spicier, but the garlic mashed potatoes and green beans were superb). Blackberry cobbler was rich and tasty. All of the portions were large, no skimping here! Lastly, the customer service was fantastic. The two young people working that day, Robin and Dustin were very polite, engaged and enthusiastic about their jobs and assisting their customers. It was such a huge difference from my normal restaurant experience that it frankly blew me away. These two excellent employees really put this place over the top for me.

T2NdMPPHmA4Uew6sFSs-mA.text: Stopped in for a quite round o' cue this evening...It'a grab a tray, go down the line and order what you want, meats and sides, kinda place.  I should have left as soon as I saw all the slabs of ribs where tightly wrapped in plastic?  Who does that? I order the 4 baby back ribs and sides of mustard greens and baked beans.  Out of mustard greens.  So I took my unsealed ribs and two sides of bake beans and a corn muffin and sat down.. The baked beans were ok..cooked well, not doused in sugar.. The corn muffin was meh.  The ribs from the plastic didn't tasted of barbecue at all.. No smoked ring on the meats, nothing....I ate them..and wish I hadn't.  I wouldn't go back unless your thang is average to below average barbecue....

30eo34dmu8Doq_bsrZ6X4Q.text: This place is decent. We are in the restaurant the first time which was ok.no one was particularly helpful our friendly but the food was good (this was when the first opened) then we found out they delivered. Places get mucho points for delivery and it's near impossible to go it to eat with 3 kids who are 3yrs as under. So we called and they informed they were not delivering that night...so we didn't order at that time...The hostess on the phone was not very apologetic and kinda rude. We tried again after purchasing a Groupon. Once again they were not delivering. The hostess said they were too busy to deliver to us. We ordered take it and had my husband go pick it up. The food is quite good...The pulled pork is my fave as well as the sausage. Haven't found a side that I really like yet. When my husband picked up the food they would only honor half of or Groupon. They said Groupon had made a mistake and they wouldn't honor the full price only hall and to save the other half for a second purchase. So we did and had to order again that next month before the Groupon expired. We called again to check if they were delivering. They were not...The hostess said o well we are under staffed right now so we are not delivering... A few days later I tried again. This time they were delivering and we used the remaining Groupon. Most likely won't be going back or ordering again. The stars come from food and flavor, but free rude staff and exuses about delivering were quite agitating. It's sad coz they really have potential. Better than the place next door (right next door is Rudys) their loss though they could have had some regular customers.

6D7YSbpbsqDDUJ57CzXi2A.text: I have been here a few times over the past year and have noticed that the food and service have steadily gone downhill!  I just saw an online news report about the 8 worst restaurants in Phoenix and they were on the top of the list.  The report was based on restaurant inspections and stated that this restaurant has failed inspection 4 times in a row.  That's pretty scary!  Usually if a restaurant fails inspection you can expect them to clean up their problems rather quickly.  This restaurant does not seem to care that they have a failing rating.  It just gets worse every week.  I would like to WARN people that they go there at their own risk!

zFj0JHkSOoiF5LxJk2T_Zw.text: The bbq sauce on point!!! I like the family deals they have! I will be back.

Mpi2hbH8_1kXWSNe72HpFQ.text: This place is awesome!  The food is fantastic.  I really like the tri-tip sandwich, but you can't go wrong with anything here.  Everything about this place i superior to Rudy's next door, the food is 10x better, the seating is better, the serving line, the way beverages are served, everything.

G2Z3QhJcOBd0tSB_OBTCaA.text: Cant Stop Smokin was featured at my job for a week through the Food Works program that brings local restaurants to our cafeteria.  Anyhow, the food was meh. Corn bread was dry and cold,  mac & cheese had to be Kraft brand as the cheese and noodle were poor quality. The chicken breast however was alright though it needed sauce to give it flavor. The portion size was far too small for the price. Their Chandler location is right by my house and I've never tried it until now. Probably won't be back.

ZgGb91-Wnhfa2Y8SL9YJXQ.text: Came in for take out last night. Ordered two of the 2meat combos. Came out to about $23 not bad at all for the portion you get.       I decided to go with the brisket and the carnitas. For my sides I got the bbq beans and the potato wedges with gravy. The meats bothhad good flavor but the brisket was definitely on the dry side. It was it was the last piece in the container could be why. The Carnitas were really really good super tender and flavorful.  My boyfriend also got the brisket and he had the same opinion for his second option he went with the sausage that was really tasty.     The barbecue baked beans absolutely delicious. They had a nice Smoky flavor with a slight kick definitely one of the better baked beans that I've had at a barbecue place. The potato wedges were just as equally good. They soak them in a garlic butter sauce and to top it off with the gravy was just perfection. Wasn't too impressed with the jalapeno cornbread I was expecting little bit more spicy flavors but still was not bad definitely will try the dinner roll next time.  I like the fact that your foods ready immediately no 45+min wait and the food to price ratio is better than their competitors. The staff was super friendly and gave good opinions on what to try.

jFNZ5jtT9mgR9D45aJEdfw.text: Came with a Groupon and I'm glad we did! We will be back for sure because of the service and APPLE COBBLER. Girl at the front counter was the sweetest and super helpful! She was awesome!

XoIT8q7tqOl85GRl8H17Jw.text: We've only ever been here with a Groupon.  The Groupon is for a BBQ picnic where you choose from 2 meats, 3 sides and one flavor of cobbler for only $20.  The original price is around $40 or $45. The amount of meat is definitely worth the money if you're feeding a family of four.  We ordered BBQ chicken and Pulled pork.  The meat given was enough to put on four sandwiches.  And there were quite a bit of leftovers for us. We're a family of 2, so my husband was able to eat at least two more meals out if he leftovers.    The food is all very good, my only complaint is that I kept burping up the BBQ flavor.  Haha. (Gross? I'm sorry)  I don't know if I would purchase the picnic deal without a Groupon/coupon.  For 40 something that just seems like A LOT, even for the amount of sides included. (Or maybe I'm cheap. Haha)  My husband definitely likes the food here so we'll be back.  I'm sure they have smaller portions too, where you won't have to buy so much food.  I'll have to try just a plate instead next time.

Si4YHHOd0iLdQbFkdoPszw.text: Picked up some go food as I was at hotel nearby. $50+ dollars for half a rack of ribs 2 beers and 2 sides. Not good enough fir that kind of money for 1 friggin person. Not to mention no one was there but the girl handling the line decided she'd make me wait for 5 minutes while she finished a call in order. Go somewhere else. This place won't be open in 6 months.

gRwEJpaqjTXPYe9LAjnEvg.text: Absolutely the best BBQ I've had in a long time. We recently moved to California and love to make a stop here when in town. The cobbler is amazing and the carnitas is so delicious! The staff are kind and welcoming as well.

ZqY9i2JbZP-ulglmrF7k_Q.text: We have been to this restaurant numerous times since I first reviewed it in November of 2016.  We love this place for brisket and almost always try to make a stop when in the area.  I'm sure the other meats are just as good but the brisket is what we always order.  It's loaded with flavor and has that deep south smokey flavor.  Delicious!  We've also taken many others with us to experience the food.  In addition to numerous meat offerings there's quite a selection of sides including potatoes, beans, carrots, salads and the desserts are fabulous.  Two sides are included and we always pick one either the peach, apple or blackberry cobbler.  Many times we even get more cobbler to go.  This place is friendly, clean and reasonable.  We love it.

OYtieuTbpUYbnDCqnCKQlw.text: Great barbecue sauce!  Love their brisket, pulled pork, & barbecue chicken.  Their garlic potatoes are delicious, potato salad and mac 'n cheese great too.  Have come here many times.  Staff is always friendly and the restaurant is clean too.

pTcLuIuYYLhRJMn8DWeAEA.text: The BBQ is really good and the regular BBQ sauce is also really good. The Mac n Cheese is a miss, tasted like a frozen dinner Mac n Cheese. The Peach cobble is amazing and a must get!

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

Gf1H0mP_CmviP4_yL8qNzg.text: OMG delicious! Meat is so tender. The sides are amazing. Especially the potatoes! Everything tasted so good! I was full to the point of bursting and couldn't stop eating!

Q6GmEuqcurqIa7idd6hkDw.text: Had them (take out) on Easter Sunday with my family and they are BOMB!! The brisket and pulled pork are scrumptious - not dry at all. Sauce is not sweet, but good and smoky. Sides were also impressive. I'm in love with their mashed potatoes. Mac salad is also very tasty. Smooth and creamy - not too sweet or heavy.   OMG - eating here is an absolute MUST! I know I'll be hitting them up again very soon. Love you, Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ. XOXO

lQRhK781yggP-zkDutwxOA.text: Came in with 3 kids (6,10,17) around 6pm on a Sunday, the place was dead, maybe 3 tables eating... Guess it was a little early. Used Groupon for family picnic. But the meats and sides were on point! Very juicy and tender. Meat server suggested the carnitas over the ribs for our  1/2# meat option, and they were great. Brisket and pulled pork also really flavourful and tender, even the beef tritip was tender. Baked beans were good, not great, everyone loved the Mac and cheese, and the mashed potatoes and gravy we're also good. Nice beer selection as well.

L8RycNSjHe-am4rOUiNOmA.text: I met an old friend at this BBQ place, the ribs were on the dry side, and I have no idea where they got the ice tea mix, it tasted like sink water!   But the staff is nice. The women took my buddy and my photo at the end of the night.

gaDhHNmJ6Y30-vQmhwHFdg.text: Got a groupon for this place and had the brisket and sausage.  Both were top notch.  The brisket was juicy and falling apart. I also added a few ribs to try and they were pretty good as well - especially the beef rib.  The sides were decent but probably not the best I've had.  The cobbler was delicious.  The customer service was great... they are super friendly here, especially the woman at the register. I will definitely come back.

J18K3JWprHVrO2w2JHh94w.text: Meh, not very good. Sausage and brisket 2 meat platter. Brisket was like an unenthusiastic handjob, it satisfied my hunger, but nothing more. The sausage was flavorful and the portions decent for the price. Mac n cheese was above average as were the green beans. Service was as to be expected, friendly and attentive. Good sauces.

cAKuRtnbxd0bn16wkj36Pg.text: The groupon deal made this a fantastic purchase. Everything was a bit more peppery than we anticipated but the meat was good: pork ribs and beef brisket. Sides were ok. Potatoes required the gravy and cornbread was a bit dry, but we fed 4 people for just about $10 a piece which makes this a good deal. Quick service too.

kXIMG1o5vOMNJ4W6fJ96WQ.text: Very good bbq brisket here and very good prices as I spent $15 on cobbler, meat, chips, and drink. Nice bbq sauces to compliment your choices. I recommend!

Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

Pf0b6SZChowIRdbuiwBIjA.text: It's not a waste of time visiting here, but the overall experience is fair, mediocre at best!  We arrived to a fairly empty restaurant on a midday Saturday, with two great desires - my salivating over getting good down home BBQ, and finding another location in the area I can come back to regularly.  But we were not impressed, it does not seem like I will return considering so many BBQ joints in the area to try.  We lunched there in a typical BBQ-style ambience... very plain, simple and non-descript decor.  Our meal consisted of Pete's Pick of baby back ribs (with little meat and on the dry side) with mashed taters & green beans.  Also had their Make it a Meal of spare ribs, pulled pork, sausage & brisket with corn on the cobb, collards (pretty good) & biscuit (dry), giving us a try of their overall menu selection.  It's totally unpretentious vibe and atmosphere, with no fantastic service or attention, it's a counter-service style, and last, but not least, a limited selection of BBQ dishes dismayed my desire to return. So much on the menu appeared mouthwatering, yet short on taste and/or legitimacy!  Being a Brisket lover, I was thoroughly disappointed with their offering!  Now don't get me wrong, it was a decent lunch, but nothing to write home about!  With so many other BBQ joints in the Valley, many others are better.

ZJ8vIkaysCGfSJYluXGcbg.text: The meats are far better than rudy's across the way.  First impression, doesn't look like much, the food evens it out over the scale. I had the lunch special- brisket sandwich, it surprised the heck out of me.  I expected it to be a tad dry like rudy's, to my amazement it was moist, tender and flavorful.

jMdTA6yli11nEOJDwr2rkg.text: Good BBQ food and friendly staff. It's odd to see how packed the competition is across the street compared to this spot. There should be more people coming here as well. They even have a cool name....  The brisket is cooked to perfection.  The Tri Tip is great  Wonderful chicken  Tasty carrots  Good potatoes!  Great sweet tea too!   Give this place a try and you'll be glad you stopped in....

bQzG16oiP-5dqWpJFNvsXA.text: The staff was really nice and seemed great, but the actual food was really sub-par. Wasn't bad, wasn't good. If I do BBQ again, I'd probably pick a different place.

IrQVYuDK_nhxlDAetR4ZdQ.text: Someone told us we had to try this. Well, that someone doesn't have good taste. The best thing was the brisket, but it was just ok, not special. The bread and sides were downright awful. The mashed potatoes tasted like boxed. Absolutely tasteless, and we had to return them. I ordered a wine. They gave it to me in a styrofoam cup. MLrJmKg4mhdZlP9cTyg3LQ.text: Meh. It's ok 2.5 stars really.   Pros: Staff is really nice. They also seem to give out a free fountain drink? Been there twice now. Both times, free drink. BBQ sauce is pretty good. Better than Rudy's next door.  In between: pulled pork. Meat is ok. Bun is good. BBQ sauce good. I threw some pickles on it, that made it a bit better.   Cons: The beef ribs are NOT worth it. $8.99lb. Really tough and way too fatty. Each rib weights about a pound! Beans are bland and just taste like a pinto bean with smoke and black pepper. I know they are can't stop smokin' but everything is suffocated in smoke and black pepper. I haven't had a side dish I've liked. Tried both beans and both potato options.  Obviously I haven't tried everything. Only been twice. Both visits I left feeling Indifferent. Probably won't be back.

CsdI8LtifuMNxM7IV1pLEw.text: Love this place. Bring home BBQ when leaving work some days. Pies look great and need to try one.

unbN80W3BIi9rG50ZEy82Q.text: Had a Groupon- really impressive; I'm from Los Angeles where there are tons of BBQ joints.  This is the first I have found in Phoenix that comes close. Brisket amazing - don't need no teeth to eat that beef:)  Ribs and pulled pork also delicious.  Mac n cheese okay needs more texture and layers of flavor, mashed garlic potatoes great, BBQ mild sauce great. I will definitely go back!

p7jEx53R8NUq88NQm1RenA.text: Went here on my first night in town with my mother and we were both very pleased.  Prices are great, especially considering the large portions!  I got the half chicken meal with baked beans and honey carrots.  The chicken was tender and well spiced and very meaty.  The baked beans had great flavor and weren't too saucy.  The carrots were sweet and a nice addition to the meal.  My mother got the smoked turkey with green beans and spinach mashed potatoes.  The turkey was so tasty and you could really taste the smoked flavor.  She loved the seasonings on the green beans and the mashed potatoes were unique and very yummy.  We both loved the jalepeno corn bread muffins which were sweet but had a nice spicy kick as well.  We tried all of the sauces and the "new" and "original" were our 2 favorites.  Every one working behind the counter were welcoming and helped us out when we explained this was our first visit.  Will definitely be returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. 2 meat meal with Smoked turkey and pulled pork with spinach mashed potatoes, corn on the cob, green beans, jalepeno corn bread
Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Half chicken meal with baked beans, carrots, and jalepeno corn bread

y_e3Q5a4i8D_j3_OTc0qrw.text: Why so much negative feedback? This place was awesome!  I went in this afternoon on a pure whim (I'd passed by it a few times) and I'm really glad I did! From the second you step out of your car you can literally smell the sweet smokiness of the meat being cooked. The atmosphere inside is really nice as well- Very clean establishment.  The best part is the ordering system: You step up to the line and order what looks good- You are able to visually pick out what you want which is awesome. And if you're really indecisive (like me) the staff is super friendly and can even make suggestions. (They'll also give you samples, you just gotta ask.)  I ended up having a Combo #4 which is St. Louis style ribs, a side of potatoes, chicken salad and a piece of the everything pie. I can honestly say there isn't anything there I didn't like.. Even their sweetened iced tea (which is just lightly sweetened and doesn't taste like corn syrup in a cup) was delicious!  The food itself was a hit but I think the most impressive thing about this place was the staff and their exceptional customer service. Nowadays it's rare to see people that are so helpful and

C_WlwZJYUz1IzC9Xl-q0ew.text: I have been to many barbecue houses and was resisting this one from some of the reviews, but tried it anyway since they are the only ones that list beef ribs. When I got there, there was hardly anyone in the building on a Friday night. Except for one employee, no one smiled or seemed to care that I was there. I saw the beef ribs and noticed they were wrapped in plastic, but I said, I will try them anyway. There were three ribs that were priced per half pound and came out to 27.00 Dollars. It was high, but I had a hankering for this type of rib, so I went for it.  Well, I should have known better. They were tough and fatty and all though they had some dark char they had no flavor at all, and quite frankly were disgusting. They simply tasted like left over ribs from days ago. Perhaps that's why they were wrapped in cellophane wrap. I should have returned them, but did not want to bother. I just threw them out and left. Even the potatoes I got were greasy and tasteless. Like earlier mentioned no one seemed to care and it certainly showed. Even the brisket through the glass looked left over and dry. For a Saturday night to have hardly anyone there, should tell you something. I went next door to Rudy's and could not even get in there were so many people in line. I should have taken the reviews more seriously. Never again.

TTQFWFp5QI5MIqY2b-wTAQ.text: I'm stuck between 2 and 3 stars...2 1/2 stars if I could. We decided to give Can't Stop Smokin a try since I had a gift certificate from work.  The atmosphere is actually really comfortable and nicely decorated to go with their BBQ theme. It's sort of cafeteria style; grab a metal tray, place your order and they'll bring it to you at the end of the line where you pay, and seat yourself.  We both ordered the #3 combos which comes with two meats, corn on the cob, two sides, dinner rolls and a drink. It's a lot of food! We could have easily shared one plate. I got the pulled pork, and the sausage. He got the brisket and sausage. For our sides we both had the baked beans and the garlic buttered potatoes. I read in other reviews the mashed are box potatoes, so I knew I wouldn't be getting any of that, I can't stand box mashed potatoes with their grainy off texture. Also...when we were looking at the sides they were offering, we saw a hair in their mashed potatoes. Yikes...  Service here was really friendly. Everyone seemed helpful and happy to be there.  The food was...okay. The sausage was moist and had some flavor, as was the pulled pork and brisket. Their BBQ Sauce I'm not a fan of. I didn't like the spicy one at all it just tasted weird, and the regular one had too much vinegar in it which gives it an almost alcohol taste. The baked beans were eh...not great but ok, just like their other dishes. The garlic potatoes I'm pretty sure are frozen and reheated. They don't taste fresh at all. I had to add a lot of salt and pepper to them to get any flavor. The corn on the cob piece was pretty good. Juicy and they add butter to it. Also their dinner rolls are really good, they're basic but they were fresh, and soft so I really liked them. For dessert we shared the apple cobbler since other Yelpers seemed to enjoy it and it was tasty. We both agreed the best tasting things on our plates were the rolls and apple cobbler.  Overall this place is decent enough, but it's overpriced compared to the quality you get. Those sides truly are poor quality, I don't think anything is made fresh, or if it is, they freeze it and reheat which downgrades the food because nothing reheated will ever taste fresh. Like I said, we only came here because we had a $10 off coupon. We're HUGE fans of Rudy's, who is literally right next door, it's a regular place for us so I think we'll stick with them instead but I'm glad we gave this place a try. If you haven't tried Rudy's you should; good prices, flavorful food, excellent BBQ sauce, and much better quality.

Lsgwd3HWjd00oGjv_Y5smA.text: I realize we all have individual experiences, but I can't imagine all the bad reviews. I originally went off of a Groupon, which helped to make it an even better deal! I was greeted upon entering and given a tutorial of all they had to offer. I had purchased the Picnic Meal with 2lbs of meat, 2 large sides, a medium cobbler, cornbread, & an entire bottle of BBQ sauce!! Claimed to be a meal for 4, but fed 5 with a little left over. The meats were cooked well and focused on natural flavors. I can't really compare it with Rudy's across the street because they use a lot of seasonings to alter their meats. I won't lie and claim it to be the best, but we had absolutely no complaints and shall definitely be coming back!

BY7eSlt8W-tvZnh9dzVagg.text: My boss suggested this place for lunch last week and I'm so happy he did! I had never been before and the BBQ was so good! I had the sliders with mashed potatoes and brought home some ribs for my boyfriend. We are definitely keeping this place on our To-Do List!
