2cSpj8gb7um6UsBZ4AipXA.text: They have a weekend special 9.99 four different meats including drink and a side which is a good value but the brisket has never been impressive, but the ribs are always good.

yoA9wG7brTigRUXneAWh8Q.text: Food was excellent.  We got a family pack and we have enough for least one or two meals to take home.

dNvbemVvNyJCAgkad8Butg.text: The girls and I decided to stop by and give this BBQ a try. We walked in and looked at the food, and I turned to them and said, "I think we should turn around, walk out, and go to another restaurant." Being the nice, thoughtful women they are, they decided that we should at least give Can't Stop Smokin' one try. So, we did.   I want my lunch hour, money, and palate back, please.  1. The turkey was very dry, and there was no flavor of smoke or of the dry rub. Nor was there any hint of a smoke ring. It shattered when touched with a fork. When I smelled it, it smelled like a combination of the hot, cheap plastic wrap it had been wrapped in combined with some sort of slightly off pork product.  1a. The turkey was STICKY when chewed. It stuck to my teeth, then turned into some sort of gummy paste with a grainy texture. I ate less than a third of my portion before throwing my hands up in defeat. And it was a struggle to get that far; my friends kept laughing at my facial expressions while I  was trying to choke it down.  2. Instant potatoes. Instant. Really? Boil up some suckers and take a masher to them, people! And the gravy from a packet wasn't that great either. Salty, salty, salty. I can feel my cells shriveling up as I type.  3. The sweet tea tasted like the container had not been properly cleaned or sanitized. A slightly musty, moldy taste lingered.   4. The hostess was EATING at the entrance and ignoring customers. We did not receive a greeting or farewell.  5. The layout is somewhat awkward, but had the food been good, I would have navigated a complex maze.   5. No condiments on the tables...until we left, and the hostess brought them out...and hour after the restaurant opened.  6. The checkout attendee was not quite on the ball, causing some confusion with our payment; we requested that two meals be paid for together, and they were rung up as just one meal, causing the her to chase us down for the remainder of the bill.  Were there any positives?  1. The lemons for the tea were huge, juicy and fresh.  2. The barbecue sauces tasted no worse than any generic one out of a bottle...but no better, either.  3. The green beans were edible.  4. I have a doggy bag full of food for my pup that the humans couldn't manage to choke down.  How would I sum up my experience? I'll let my friend's statement do that for me:  Her: I have barbecue sauce on my finger.  Me: Lick it off.  Her: I don't want to put that stuff back in my mouth, once was bad enough.

6jd4kHTYfnOlbsMhsRoc3A.text: Used a groupon which made this an exceptional deal. BBQ is high quality and delicious.  The sides are ok, cobbler dessert is really yummy.  Drinks are a good value too.  Staff are friendly, place is clean.  Will return!

2d783hNFcUPxlyOqXmzg8w.text: Lived in the Memphis area for about 10yrs, this place would compete with the BBQ places out there for sure! We had the platter for a group of coworkers and it was amazing. From the BBQ beans, ribs, chicken, brisket, it was all great. Will be back soon!

h_V1_6jyj3l-uMrR-_H6iA.text: Ordered some take out tonight and couldn't have been more pleased. The past few visits to FD left a lot to be desired so decided to change it up and check out "Can't Stop Smokin BBQ" First, walking in the door you are exposed to a tremendously pleasant aroma of BBQ & meat. Moving onto the deli counter to place my order I was greeted by a gentleman who couldn't have been friendlier. One thing that stood out for me was that he wrapped the to go containers nicely in plastic wrap.  I have never had my take out wrapped like that. It was a nice touch that more restaurants should take note of. I ordered the combo #4 - sandwich and chose the brisket for the meat with Elsie's Garlic Potatoes and Smokin Joe's Baked Beans for my sides.  Wife had combo #6 - 4 pork ribs; she opted for the baby back style (spare rib is the other option). She went with the mac & cheese and spinach mashed potatoes for her sides. As I mentioned in my intro our past couple of visits to FD were very disappointing. This was the complete opposite. The meat was tender, moist, not fatty and very flavorful.  Both the baked beans and the mac & cheese had great flavor - really nice smoky flavor to the beans. Both the garlic potatoes and spinach mashed potatoes were a little bland. That is the only slight criticism of the meal. I will give Can't Stop Smokin another visit but will probably skip the potatoes as a side. I'll try something else or get a double of the beans.

Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. beef brisket

1MHLYTGi2bsQ91k5KZwcYA.text: One busy Sunday, one day before school starts for the children. We had to leave church early due my little boy was in pain from mosquito bites. Thoughts of west nile virus going through my head since there was confirmed cases in our area. Long story short, we get medication for him he feels better we continue to finish school shopping.   Time to stop and grab some lunch. Everyone is hungry and little bit on the irritated side. We stop into Can't Stop Smoking BBQ, yes it's a real place in Chandler AZ. As soon as we open the door this lady was there greet us. Instantly, she knows my little boy is not on the happy side. She grabs him small plate of Mac n cheese. Man, his face lit up in happiness. This made me and the wife smile not because of a free item but going above and beyond. Her kindness continued as she rang us up. Just the happiest personality you can think of.   She continued to share this attitude with everyone including her employees. People were saying to their family how nice and happy she was. As we left, I had to return the appreciation. As I waited for her to finish her conversation with a customer I told her "You have made this visit very special and you kind attitude has made our day better". She was greatly appreciated.   Time to finish the shopping. The attitude passed on to us and we shared it with many other doing small gracious things making everyone smile.

ocWpXltuEIPK4446bzEL7Q.text: Not impressive at all. The wait staff was not welcoming. When I mentioned it was my first time, the young man said well there's the menu...really that's the response towards someone who has never been to your restaurant. The meats wrapped in plastic it's a good sign either. That's means they have been sitting out for a while. No one was happy to be here!!! Not a single person had a smile. The food was less than average.  It was a clean place, I'll give them that. I have a lot more to say but you get the point.   Custom service should be a list art. It should be on the forefront of business. First impressions are everything. Especially when you have Rudy's next door.

y9Hs3wOWzhiIEok6MgN5lA.text: Love this place because of the low key atmosphere and pretty fast cafeteria style service. Definitely been a steady pace of customers every time I come in. For this trip I got the 2 meat combo with two sides, bread, and a drink. I stuck with my usual trip tip and brisket but I added an additional 2 ribs because I've never tried them and was curious. The meats are great for the price and the sauce goes a long way that adds that needed taste to the food. All this food was about $18.00 not too bad I would say.

Qvri1Ym3rqtfxrz5DJOWHQ.text: I don't think this place is going to win any awards but it certainly has some good q. Its difficult to find places that do baby back ribs and this is one of the joints that does. Standard Texas cafeteria style setup where you go down the line and choose what you want. Meats are dry rub and smoked with what I would guess is pecan; it has a very smoky flavor to it and the meat is on the drier side. There are two sauce options: regular and spicy. A plethora of meat and side options are available and they also have some daily specials that are worth checking out.

g9zbgxsBzQXM7h3XA2foCQ.text: First time here. Orders are placed cafeteria style at a counter. Couldn't understand why all of he smoked meats were commercially "sealed" in shrink-wrap and cut open as needed.  Was the meat shipped in? Got the 2 meat plate for $11, which came with 2 sides and a self-service drink, so the price was way less than I expected. Once I sat down, I couldn't help but notice the black light fixtures and some inflatable black football helmets hanging from the ceiling were covered in dust, which was very off putting. Dining table was sticky. Otherwise, the massive timber infrastructure and tables were pretty cool.  I got the pulled (mushed) pork and brisket, both tasted smoky and weren't too bad for the price paid. Mac and cheese was baked macaroni with a stadium nacho cheese sauce. The red potatoes with herbs were very good. Please clean this place up! Seeing the dirty dining room made me wonder what the kitchen looked like.

z54EZsz0hPpV27WDHeR4sQ.text: Friendly, kind, accommodating service; quality and plentiful cuisine; very affordable prices. Highly recommend.

OuBzlRb-IfnimkHk2ZKBiw.text: It was hard to come here for bbq when Rudy's is right next door.  Glad we have it a try.  I would give Rudy's the edge for bbq overall, but this place has more options for sides,which were quite tasty.    It's quite a bit cheaper than Rudy's as well.  I really wish they had jalapeno sausage though.

uHbZly0VHVyyJdgdDFmfOg.text: Our party of 3 came in on a Sunday before 8pm.  We were warned they were closing in a hour.  That was fine as we were found to see a movie at 9:15p so we were going to be gone well before that.  The gentleman on staff that evening was very pushy in reminding us when they closed coming to our table multiple times to remind us they were closing before 8:30p.  I understand they want to get home on Sunday evening but pushing customers out the door will not get you to repeat customers.  I live out of town, but the two people with me are not so they most like will not be back. The food was ok. Food alone, I can't say I would come back.

atacnFuvM08MVfsO_EI-PQ.text: This should be a fast food barbecue joint. Ribs are wrapped in plastic and  they lack seasoning. The staff seems to be very irritated, if you are not sure what to order their response is very rude making you feel uncomfortable and rushed. I ordered the number 3 comb which consist of two meats and two sides. My choices were spareribs sausage link Season potatoes macaroni and cheese Choice of bread was a jalapeno muffin.  I went with those choices because the greens looked old and soggy everything seem like it was set out all day. I'm going to end this. I have to go to the restroom this food is not settling with my stomach. Sorry eat at your own risk. Some guy in the back keeps sneezing without covering his mouth today gross!

GDzpnzoEx26FZJ0m-KTjOw.text: This place was so good. Helpful staff too. Food and bbq sauce was very good. For sure coming back

HrBS4n54xxQAelLqFr6sog.text: I definitely should have read the reviews before I went here, especially the unrecommended reviews because they are on target with my experience here. The good, the brisket was very tender, the portion size was fine and the macaroni salad was very good. The bad, although the brisket was tender it was flavorless except for a slight plastic wrap flavor. It was such an odd, offputting flavor that no matter how hard I tried I couldn't eat more than a few bites. I added some sauce, I believe it was called Original Sauce and once again there was very little flavor, very bland. The mashed potatoes were okay, I think the addition of the gravy and knowing I wasnt going to eat for several hours encouraged me to suck it up and eat them. I may have expected too much from the simple dinner roll, it was ehhhh. Adding butter didn't even make me want to eat it.  I feel like I cheated on my favorite BBQ restaurant and got what I deserved.

iBAz7EsnQU-mhhkNixLslQ.text: I hope this is just a one time occurrence since all other reviews seem to be raving.    This was our first time at Can't Stop. It was the worst experience I have had in a long time. The one gentleman working the meat section of the line was trying to create a good experience but beyond that it was downhill. The meats were dry and not fresh. The sides looked aged and tasted bland. The cashier instead of trying to work with us on our misunderstanding of the groupon just had an I don't care attitude.   Recommendation to manager/owner...kids can't run a restaurant on a busy Friday night.

9cxFKcRMDGfYP6LsN5rjIA.text: Whenever I'm in the area I make it a point to stop here. The mustard greens are rare, tasty dish with the perfect amount of heat. Their potatoe salad is about the best I've ever tasted. The prices are very reasonable and the service is very quick and courteous. This visit however, both meats that I chose were quite sub-par! Both the brisket and the tri-tip were dry, extremely chewy and way too well done for my liking. Hopefully this incident was just a fluke.

YlwuFPxESym4bBEJCmz2PQ.text: I absolutely love this food!  The wait staff were fine and accommodating. The BBQ is fantastic and they have a great variety of sides.

DttxMGUqu64DwtGVkX2A8A.text: Best pork ribs since long time. Tasty, fresh... tried three times and it was always great.  It's not 5 starts restaurant but if you  just died for ribs... Don need to be that nice inside

SmqXfT7tKfJGGUn0S1G6Ow.text: Today was my first time trying out this place and I absolutely LOVED IT!!!  It wasn't crowded and the food was amazing!  I had the #3 Combo (2 meats, 2 sides).  I got the tri-tip and pulled pork.  The sides were corn on the cob and jalapeno corn bread.  Every single bite was mouth watering and full of flavor!!!  I'm visiting from San Diego, but the next time I'm here I will definitely be back!!!  Also, the staff was excellent with explaining to me where everything was and were all very attentive!!

IVGMC4knJFfq_mJYZl-2vg.text: Motivated by a restaurant.com certificate we tried this place again. Together we ordered the sausage, brisket, tri-tip, ribs, pulled pork, garlic potatoes and green beans. Breaking it down: The tri-tip had no smoke flavor. It was a nice cut of meat and tasted like a nice cut of meat. But no seasoning or smoke flavor evident. Dipping in their "original" sauce added some flavor. I also tried their "spicy" sauce which, frankly, wasn't that spicy and had a flavor I didn't really care for. They were honest that they don't make the sausage. I can respect that. The sausage itself was good. Not as good as Rudy's, but good. The brisket was arguably the best item we had. Moist, tender, and had some evidence of smokiness to it. Again, dip in the original sauce and it was actually pretty good. The spareribs were nice. Decent smoky flavor. I ate mine without sauce and they were pretty good. The pulled pork was OK. I think it had more smoke flavor than our last visit (where I commented that there wasn't any). But both my wife and I noted that there was something different about it. Not really sure what. Was it really smoke? Not sure, but I'll give the benefit of the doubt here. The green beans were average. Overcooked severely, and I happen to like my green beans a little overcooked. But this was probably too much. The potatoes were ok but not much garlic flavor. We got a sample of their baked beans, but after tasting them opted not to make them one of our sides. Van Camp's with a pinch of seasoning. Compare and contrast to Joe's Real BBQ with their beans...it's not even close. And Rudy's has their green chile stew that is really good. The sides here are very uninspired and uninspiring. The folks behind the counter weren't really enthusiastic this time, but they were friendly and patient, and answered questions without making us feel like we were keeping them from something. No complaints there. One annoyance was when I asked the cashier about upgrading the beverage in the combo. Normally it's a fountain drink, but I didn't want a fountain drink. If figured if they charge me the difference I can get something better. They didn't say I couldn't, so I thought it was cool. We got a different beverage and.ended up paying full price for it (which I didn't realize until I had the printed receipt). That's kinda not cool. Overall I really can't give them any more stars this time than last time. It's still "I've experienced better". It's not bad, but I think they miss on too many flavor points to get excited about this place. There are several others out there that do a better job in the flavor department. Which is too bad. As near as I can tell this is the only location, so it's a local shop not a franchise (like Dave's BBQ or Rudy's BBQ are franchises...they have several locations including in other states). I like finding single-location places because the quality is usually better, in my opinion. But I just can't recommend this one.

LONKrhIjBeqqTOQZ79JjxQ.text: I probably will give this place a 2.5 stars.. the staff was friendly but the food was just okay..nothing special, you defin get what u paid for..we had better bbq at other places.. we both got a sausage sandwich and brisket sandwich with corn on the cobb, mac and cheese and mashed potatoes..we spent about $15 we also used a 20% discount from yelp if u eat here between 3-5 (or something like that) ..

lZc7YBor8y3Bv0nPq3bJVw.text: It's been years but what can I say?  Almost 7 since we ate here, time truly flies.  I believe their meats have improved since then.  The staff is less exuberant now but kind and a bit friendly.  The menu and the environment has changed little.  Their brisket was lean but a bit dry and their pulled pork was tender and delicious.  There were 2 bbq sauces available and given to you in little plastic cups.  One sweet and one hot which was not really spicy hot.  13 sides were offered, I had mustard greens, which I thought were wonderful and corn on the cob, sweet and of course over cooked, but good tasting.  The bread came with 2 choices, a dinner roll (soft, nice tasting, we liked it a lot, and a jalapeno corn bread muffin (not spicy, somewhat heavy and dry, I would avoid it).  Their cobbler desert came in peach, apple and berry.  We had the peach cobbler which was excellent. I heard their cookies were quite good.  Definitely a meal worth 4 stars.

0umt6b5NGn-jCzH-og7Feg.text: It was ok. Nothing memorable. The only reason I chose this place over the one across the street was because they have individual meals. (I was by myself).   it was alright, a little over-priced but not bad. Although, I ate there at the end of the night, and none of it was fresh.. meh.

0dhM-lE-zfQSQ5PMhCEyvQ.text: The staff was talking consistently rather than servicing the customers.  When the one person working was overwhelmed and asked for help, his co-worker or boss seemed irritated with him.  The inattentiveness to the customers and the fact that the line was building up was unacceptable.  We stood at the register longer than we should have had to.  The food is also not good so I don't see any reason to ever return to this establishment, especially considering Rudy's is right across the street.  This was our second visit - trying to give them the benefit of the doubt, but they've proven that our first sad experience was not an outlier but more of the way things are done here.  So long, can't stop smokin.'

fly26SMJ-YT8fvZM2bAsEg.text: I tried to call in a pick up order and they told me to go through the site. You're already on the phone with me. Just take my order goddammit. I now go to Pigglys for my turkey legs.

-ErbwJuaYdElQ4yeyi1MgQ.text: This place is the REAL DEAL. I could smell the smoke from their place across the street at my hotel the other night. So I decided to try them on my last night in town. The meats were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Their sauces were tasty as were their sides. Highly recommend them. I will be back.

J2sO2buPk0i4QfvwMJ2s7g.text: This was my first time here as my husband has been here before, I got the two combo plate which was two meats two sides, corn muffin and a drink. I choose the brisket and the chicken along with some mash potatoes and mac and cheese. I was a bit confused when I saw the metal trays as I knew this was a lunch style cafeteria, but when I saw the plates I felt better lol I thought for a second I was eating off the metal trays ... Anyhow honest review... Brisket was okay it def had the smoke taste and flavor but it was on the dry side, and for me I loveeee the fats on the brisket and I was very happy they put at least a piece on there for variety butttttttt.... My piece with the fat was very weird tasting full of char and almost gamey like so I'm not sure what exactly happened? The chicken was very tender but it was definitely bland and thank goodness for their house  bbq sauce that made the dish a tad bit better. My mac and cheese was wonderful and standard, but the mash potatoes left a weird taste in my mouth! For some reason the texture was very very creamy it's hard to describe almost like it wasn't mash potatoes and the flavor was just overpowered with pepper. Overall I like the concept I would probably go back to try the pulled pork instead and some other meats, but this just my honest review... Maybe it'll be better next time?

y341CarVJgLV-VmVOyqIfg.text: We decided to stop in again and glad to report things were definitely better. The meat was great just like last time but the sides were much improved.  Glad to see they stepped it up and as a result my rating increased as well.

OV0EAQzjXZiv9J6qBoCpgA.text: Pretty darnn good had the brisket , pork shoulder. Mac and greens... very tender and tasty

Q1Cb67kZOCteOcf9vdo3AA.text: I was on my way to pick up my wife at PHX airport.  On the way up, I was famished, so I pulled off to have some dinner.  Rudy's was closer to the exit, so I ate there and had the most rubbery ribs I can recall eating ever.  Yuk,  On the way back to Tucson, I brought my wife to Can't Stop Smokin.  She had the same kind of ribs that I had at Rudy's.  We ordered a large amount so I could try them also.  Can't Stop Smokin's ribs were smoky and tender and delicious.  The sides were pretty good too.  Not the best ribs I've ever had (like Coulter's or Dickey's in Dallas) but pretty darned good.   Next time I'm in the area, I'll stop here for food.

CdlujSLSkcFc2AS2HxxPmA.text: Disclosure to be fair: not a big meat eater. Very friendly staff from the moment you enter and place was clean. Carry out order with brisket and pulled pork, not dry, would order again. Noticed sign with all day beer $2.50 and wine $3 specials, great for a Saturday.

wmzi457M4N56ru2lwoMnjA.text: Located in Chandler off Chandler Boulevard close to the i 10. Directly across from Rudy's barbecue I went in here with high expectations but quickly they turn to low expectations. The help wasn't helpful at all in fact I won't return because of the service, the place appeared to be run by a bunch of kids when I walked in , but told the girl behind the front counter that her sign on the front door still said they were closed she just giggled an the guy working behind the counter cutting the meat wasnt helpful or polite and well the food was lets say ive purchased barbecue at the grocery store deli counter that was better. The potato salad was powder'y yuck and the bbq beans well I've had beans from can that were better! The brisket was presliced sitting in a pan with what looked like gravy. personally I'd skip this place

AtGLHijsng1qrb6NhNupkA.text: Have been here many times in past and have always had good food. However, tonight was different. First they ran out of beef brisket, then they had limited drinks available. I tried the pulled pork and ribs. The pork was okay but the ribs were tough and no better than what I could have made at home, a big disappoint. No sure if I would give another shot or just go to Dickies.

G8GMDCjwAVOQ1M6e7-xGYQ.text: YOU HAVE TO BUY A SOFT DRINK TO GET A WATER CUP LARGER THAN 6 OUNCES!!!!!!  We've been customers since they opened.  The BBQ has been hit and miss at times, but is generally OK.  We nearly always get "take out," but for some reason during our most recent visit we decided to eat in.  I don't drink alcohol and have never enjoyed soda pop with BBQ, so I asked for water just like I always have.  Imagine my shock when the cashier handed me a 6 ounce cup for my water!  I complained, and the cashier gave me a second 6 ounce cup.  I was not pleased.  OK, then I got it.  Peter wants to force me to pay for a soft drink so I could get a decent size cup for my water.  And it doesn't matter how much you am spending on your meal..... if you insist on water you get a 6 ounce water cup or pay the added charge for soda pop.    We hadn't paid yet, so I announced we were leaving.  At that point a long-time staff member gave me a 12 ounce cup at no charge, saying she did not want to lose my business.  I still had to refill it two or three times during the course of the meal, but it was much better than the 6 ounce cup.  She also said I would have to talk with Peter about this policy.  Just to be clear, your attempt to nickle and dime me over something like a water cup just about tears it with me.    So Peter, you better listen up pardner.... if you want to run a fast food type of joint, then your water cup policy is fine with me.  I just won't do business with you.  But If you want to operate a BBQ restaurant your water cup policy needs to CHANGE BACK TO THE WAY IT WAS IF YOU WANT TO KEEP MY BUSINESS.

ILokmrle5w8LBa94rjOI8g.text: Staff is so friendly & place to so homey! Hands down the best Bbq, and the cobblers are to die for!!! I would DEFINITELY recommend to family and friend. 5 out of 5 stars!

ezquwCu0XQdjpdrCPhEruA.text: If this place invented the pulled pork parfait....they should be given an award! This place is also kind of cafeteria style. Grab a tray and step up to the meat counter. There are plenty of meat-tastic items to choose from. I sampled the brisket after a pal ordered it and loved it.  Obviously I ordered the parfait. Two types of beans to choose from. I went with the more country style, not the jalapeno ones, but only bc I'm more of a country beans type of gal. Next up, potato layer...3 types of potatoes to choose from! Red potato wedges, garlic mashed and some froofy spinach mashed potato. I went with the classic red wedge. The others looked great I just wanted the potato as a whole piece instead of mashed. Finally, this masterpiece is topped with pulled pork. Mmmmm! I sauced this guy at the table myself. I love both of their sauce options, one spicy, one a tad more sweet and classic.   Great happy hour bottled beer special til 6, I think! Great apple and cherry pie. Peach cobbler....yum!  I will definitely be back! I have the other half of my groupon to use!

IA-p9opvwXh7e1uXMMp2ZQ.text: This place is a solid four stars. The sides are great. I haven't had the ribs yet but the brisket is outstanding. The smokie flavor is so prominent in the meat that you can actually use the sauce sparingly - which is how barbecue should be. BTW, don't bother with the place across the street.

l1gnoDtWBz_9nw1hNUNK6A.text: Great delivery service. Food was great. Showed up in less than 30mins. Very good meat!  Had the brisket and pulled pork! Good spicy sause, good jalapenos bread, average prices.   Great service! Awesome people.

4EgC6uYtLb3ouuagheTg2w.text: .. Food was lukewarm, carnitas meat was prob the best of all the meat we tried. The red potatoes we ok. My hubby says "everything was cold except for the pie which was supposed to be cold..." Considering there is another BBQ place right across the street, we will be going back to them. Always gotta try Something once and in this case this was our 2nd time in many moons. Our 1st experience was when they 1st opened... Again, food wasn't as tasty then either.  Giving them 3 stars for the peach pie, carnitas, and beautiful wood work on the furniture otherwise  it would be 1 or 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Needed a lot of salt &amp; pepper for the Mac &amp; cheese. Food was lukewarm  carnitas meat was prob the better meat we tried.

6PEKhbLw9o4r2poolrRPXA.text: Now I know why they don't have a contact email. They don't want to face their reviewers.  When this place opened, I was very impressed, thought it could be better than Rudy's (across the street). Well, after a bit of time, we went back. Mistake. The guy helped my family, then when I said I thought  the Market price on brisket was a bit high and Rudy's was lower, he said "'yea, it is," walked off and ignored me - jerk. My son got the ribs and thought they were too spicy. His taste, not theirs. My wife brought them up and the guy actually started to argue with her. A-hole. Since when does an employee decide what a customer's tastes are., He reluctantly said "well, we can't take them back". I was going to return the chicken breast, but decided I didn't want to deal with their attitudes again. The breast, by the way was the driest chicken I've ever had. I couldn't drink enough tea to wash is down. The pie? Bland and salty. Beans - vomit.  Now I know why Rudy's had a line out the door and you could hear crickets in this place. We only came over because Rudy's had the line - next time its worth the wait.  Here's some friendly advice for you yahoos at CSSBBQ - if you are going to build a smoked BBQ restaurant next to an incredibly popular, great tasting place. Try a little harder and be a bit more accommodating to the few customers you have. Oh, and have a good product.  They may not come back - I know I will never set foot in this joke of a BBQ place again. Give it up.

S6t9K6Acxuf42wk4ovfqoQ.text: We head into this location for lunch quite often. The BBQ is pretty good and the prices are very reasonable for lunch. The staff is always friendly!

dDjWyTaluIbcnd3t6fWbIQ.text: Was just here for lunch..  The Brisket had great flavor and was superbly tender (fell apart when a fork touched it).  The service was fast and friendly, I'd be happy coming back!

6LlKjur3usbN1qksZ1frYA.text: LOVEEEEEEEEEEEE this place.... I love BBQ and this is good BBQ but the killer is you need sides... Rudy's across the street has crap for sides so I always go here, because they actually have SIDES!!!! The sides can make the meal. Loved it and the Customer Service is always awesome. I think its silly people don't like the "rustic feel of how you get your food" they are crazy!!!

gvfnCL7QFrwMqSMtHbYPNw.text: This place is so good!  Everything I've had has been just yummy.  So much better then rudys across the street, I think the bad reviews have been from rudys workers.   The inside of this place is awesome, The people are friendly, and the food is great!  Worth going to and trying! The sliders are just the right size and the cobbler is to die for!

x43r-FqLl222Pr9bxDg5Sg.text: The whole-smoked chicken was horrible. Dry, overcooked, no juice...looked nothing like their photo; so far everything else is great & tasty except for the yardbird. Could be done so so SO much better.

T9K_E-ZEwSQ7yEMvo2xhuQ.text: I love some good BBQ, and when I find a good place, I know it. And this place..... was NOT one of the "good places". When you walk in to the very empty restaurant, you notice there is no smell of smoked meats, which is odd if they are selling smoked meats. The food is served cafeteria style. We tried the sausage, which tasted like store bought sausage. It was not at all special. We also tried the carnitas which lacked flavor, brisket which was soaking in a water solution, ribs which were average, Mac and cheese which wasted like gummy noodles, baked beans that were likely from a can, and corn bread that was rubbery and so bad it got spit in the trash. The BBQ sauce had an ok flavor, but it was very thin. The rub on the brisket was a sugary rub, which was about the only flavor I noticed besides a liquid smoke flavor. If you're looking for a great BBQ spot, head towards Can't Stop Smokin, then turn into the parking lot across the street and go into Rudy's and order any of the meats and the green chile stew.

uKsxYl_mwDqYOUY4cw7S9A.text: Ok, decided to try this place, after already checking out Rudy's (across the street).  Step 1. Went in the front door, NOBODY there to greet you.  We waited a few more mins. Then just walked in.  We asked the "kids" in front the the cafeteria style food.  Do we seat ourselves?  (&**#*&$*&*@&) he mumbled.  Didn't quite, understand what he said.  So we, grabbed the menus and started asking questions, Cuz nobody, told us "anything" about how to order,etc.... anywho.... we order the #3.  Now, you can add either a baby back or spare rib for a buck more, which we did.  The meal comes with either lemonade or ice tea.  NOTE:  we had to ASK for the baked beans, for our meal.  They didn't have them out to see.  Instead, the had these "HUGE" trays of HUGE potatoes (Think a russet potato, cut into 4's) wayyyy too much. And it DIDN'T make me think,,,, ahhhhh I'm here for some BBQ.  I passed on the Mountain Man, potatoes, and asked, Hey, do you have baked beans??? He said, oh yeah,  and scooped me out some.  We get out dranks, and head to the table..... WTF!!! ALL the FOOD is " C O L D "!!!! not luke warm.... Fricking " C O L D " we nibble and then I tell the "Mgr"  our food is cold.  The Couple in front of us, said Their food was cold too! So, they go about explaining, they didn't know the warmer was off, etc  They took our food, and said they would get us more, and it would be hot.  They turned their warmers back on.  OK,,,,,, 2nd Round.  I got the Fricking Dam Mountain Man Potatoes.  NOT what i had on my plate the first time..  Plus.... we couldn't figure out what was so dam Hot..... They pile on "PEPPER" on these potatoes.  I LOVE hot, but it was alittle too much for me.. The food was STILL "warm-cool" . Neither of us, wanted to eat it.  They did offer to refund our purchase.  Which I took. They did ask me how the food was.  I didn't want to tell them it was, awful. But, the manager insisted.  So, I told her, It wasn't good.  I took my refund.  I think it could be a Good place. Its new, and they have some kinks to work out. Here's my suggestions, for whats its worth:  1. Have someone at the front to greet the guest. Especially 1st timers. 2. Put the "Bar B Q" fixings to the front.  Not them dam Over-sized Pepper Tatters!  Yuk 3. The Chicken Breast was SO dang dry. Probably, better to shread them 4. The Ribs.... I didn't even eat mine. So, I cant give an opinion on it.  But, It didn't look appetizing either. 5. Make sure the Food is "HOT"  Will I go again..... Probably Not.  Will I reccomend?....Probably  Not.  As a matter of fact. 2 guys were on their way in, and asked how the food was.  I had to answer, honestly.   Mmmmm,  Ech,  Think they went across the street. Cuz, they went in, got the menu and left.  btw: Rudy's, is "slightly" better.  At least the food was hot.  I'm NOT a Rudy's fan either, but Id probably go back there

hHA2TUbW3ZoJYdhoNm22_A.text: I used to lpve rudys but now I have a new love. They do serve pepsi. But have coke cans. The apple cobbbbbbler is the best. Maybe the best desert I ever had. Incredible doesn't do it justice. The guy in front of me had a coupon for a sampler which isn't on the menu. You need coupon to get that. Not sure why the ratings are so low. I like this place.

vTTG6bNXe3ivp8yEEVavww.text: My wife and I have been here twice now.  We always get 2 meats with sides for about $12-13.   The only meat that isn't really good is the turkey, so if your going to try this place stay away from it.  You grab a tray, tell them what you want and eat.  If you don't like simple fast BBQ, then this place won't be for you.

XHNPclnE0avNheaUQPdhiw.text: Horrible horrible horrible. Ordered a couple of racks of ribs and took them home. Ribs were dry, sauce didn't even help them. Called to complain and was told there was no way the ribs were that bad.No offer to replace, was told to go elsewhere. Avoid this place.

bqNW_OasN58cT_vxhdNLmQ.text: BBQ was ok, nothing outstanding, but the staff is friendly and helpful, next time I'm in Chandler, may have to give it another try.

gqUUlhtIhopUMsOSTiTTDg.text: I eat here a lot for lunch.  It's hard to beat the lunch special where you get real smoked meat, a side (cobbler FTW) and a drink for around $7.  Compare that to the garbage many fast food joints serve for the same price.  Their forever 'new' BBQ sauce is my favorite (labeled in bottles near the heated sauces).  Several of their staff are really friendly and cool.  Overall enjoyable lunch every time.

LF5iGc3HIrPZ1ODB4qfWZg.text: Went back  and tried the brisket and the carnitas. Both were very good. The brisket was very tender and flavorful as was the carnitas. Loved the jalapeno beans, the mac and cheese was just ok.

syv09XdLyHIV_EUiYehjNg.text: We have used Can't Stop Smokin' on numerous occasions  The restaurant is clean, the food is good, and the service is just right.  Their pork loin is very tender and their sides are all very tasty.  You don't have to order "smoked" if you don't want it.  Will keep coming back.

hKDUcaLf1UrINhTJZdTtjQ.text: For me, a statistical tie to its neighbor, Rudy's.  Neither very impressive. I ate here in early May (a week after Rudy's) and I do not think they were quite ready to open.  The layout and line management are clumsy.  The staff is poorly managed - it felt like watching a ladybugs soccer match (everyone runs toward the ball with nobody sticking to their stations).  And there is no reason I should have to carry a menu through a cafeteria style restaurant, where I am also carrying a bulky food tray (with 2 hands).  Just look at your neighbor - put the menu on the menuboard! Sauce tasted off-the-shelf, but was still better than its neighbor's, Rudys. 3-stars are for potential.  The meat is decent.  Work out the kinks on the staff, side dishes and desserts, then do a few more tenant improvements to the menuboard and line management (see Rudy's drink tubs and cold side dish cooler), get some good beer, scrap the heavy cookie sheets used as food trays... and maybe this place can out-last Rudy's.

Ud6sW-X-7dCxsPQ23V_HaQ.text: Meh.   If this place were as good at having poor reviews hidden away as that over-hyped, over-priced, under-smoked waste of money Rudy's is, it might appear more as Rudy's equal, and to be clear, that's less of an indictment of Can't Stop Smokin's basic mediocrity and more of an indictment of Rudy's flavorless excuse for Texas barbecue and tasteless approach to review sites.  I tried the pork spare ribs, Tri-tip, and sausage  ere at Can't Stop Smokin and none of them were anything to write home about or tell friends "hey, ya gotta try this!".  They were just...OK.  At least they had some smoke in them, and they weren't just seasoned with 18 lbs of black pepper, which is more than can be said for anything on the menu across the street.  Same thing goes for the sides;  they're just OK.  The mac & cheese was pretty good, but the corn on the cob was mushy, the potatoes were bland,  and the butter they serve is simply butter flavored spread.    The Sauce:  Not bad.  On the sweet/bland side, but not bad.  The place was clean, the staff was helpful and nice, and the linemen carefully trimmed the excess fat from the tri-tip before serving it, but between these two joints at this intersection, I've had it up to here with "barbecue" of questionable provenance that comes out of bins wrapped in saran-wrap before it's cut and served.     Phoenix:  Where's the GREAT barbecue?  The real kind that comes out of a real smoker right before it's served?   Is there any in this town?  This intersection here in Chandler sure doesn't have it, and neither do any of the handful of other places I've been here.

aoEKY0UOf5dhbCZtV43F1Q.text: A few weeks ago I headed over the Rudy's I wasn't very in pressed with there food to the point that I didn't finish my tray. Once we left that location I noticed across the street Can't stop smokin, and said I will have to try them....i did and I will definitely go back to Can't Stop Smokin.  Loved that I was all able to taste samples. This way I wasn't paying for something I wouldn't eat.  I had baby back , turkey and tri-tip all very tasty. Staff was very friendly. Clean over all and liked that I didn't feel like I smelled of BBQ after we left.  My kids keep asking to go back too bread and cobbler was a hit.

eLti2msFhR9OBdInlhFChA.text: Still in search of a BBQ place that blows my mind.  In the central coast, they invented the stuff, so a good tri-tip is always on the brain so i decided to stop by (even thought there was another bbq place ironically parked next door). Well, this place was decent and I would go to again. A few of the foods were bland but decent portion sizes for not much coin. What i did enjoy is how everyone, from the front counter to the line cook to the cashier to everyone was absolutely friendly and helpful. Made some of their own choice recommendations. I enjoyed it. Upon leaving, the guy even stopped me to ask me how it was - I let him know what i thought. I think he's book his trip to Santa Maria/San Luis Obispo.

oYLtiGmUeBukCtxxci-DAw.text: I almost didn't write this review after I read the others, because I am pretty much just echoing what has been said.  I don't mind serve yourself cafeteria style, but we had to lug these huge metal pans along with the menu through the line. Not an easy task. I asked for the brisket  sandwich and the line server asked if I like sauce. I said sure...so he loaded me up with the stuff already swimming in sauce. First big mistake. My sides were coleslaw and mac and cheese (both very bland and not worth more than one taste) My husband looked at the stuff on my tray and went with the tri-tip (no sauce) and beans and garlic potatoes. He was able to eat his sandwich and potatoes at least. I took one bite of the brisket and nearly gagged from the amount of vinegar in the sauce. And the meat had been in the tray so long, it was hard to tell if it really was meat. UGH.  No second chances, sorry. Just too much not to like.

AhlwdNeaIt8tjXpRHU3k2Q.text: (Will probably be a five star when I can get a cold beer to enjoy with my BBQ)  First tried their smoked beef jerky at a charity golf tournament before they opened and it was delicious. The interior is beautifully done and a tribute the the owner of this franchise who also builds custom log homes. They are serious about smoked meats as you might derive from the name and it doesn't disappoint. All the meats I have tried (jerky, brisket, tri-tip, baby back ribs & sausage) are smoked perfectly and really did not require any sauce to enhance the flavor. If you prefer sauce on your meats they have you covered as well. Both the regular and the southwest style are very good. I haven't tried to many of the sides yet, but the jalapeno beans and coleslaw were both pretty good. I really love the enthusiasm and knowledge of the GM and the staff. Very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and the history of the restaurant. It has a small family owned feel to the business that I hope they are able to keep as they expand the concept outside of New Mexico and Arizona. Definitely a home run for me and I will make it a regular in the rotation.

cY5g3BCZiXl7JqK60vuxiQ.text: I've been here twice in the past six months and both times everything was great! I loved the tri tip and brisket. Both amazing, juicy, and tender. The smoky flavors are the best part of the meal. The mashed potatoes were a little too stiff for my liking but that doesn't mean a thing to me in terms of the BBQ. The staff is friendly and helpful too. Five stars!

YYI9MG5_DFGgswy6N7AH2Q.text: I thoroughly enjoyed the brisket, it was moist and fall apart tender with great flavor and the bbq sauce was hot and spicy. The greens were surprisingly good, lots of flavor, the mac n cheese was on par with other mac n cheese ive had at bbq places, tasty but nothing special. The red potatoes were fine, they had seasoning on them but were just kind of plain to me, and the cornbread had a good texture and taste but as my personal preference I dont enjoy cornbread with corn kernels in it. The chicken had really good flavor, but as white meat does..it got dry during cooking. We dipped it in that bbq sauce and were happy. We Also got tye peach cobbler but none of us really liked it. There was more plain hard dough chunks than anything else, definitely not enough peach or spice. 4 stars might seem pretty generous when I only truly enjoyed maybe half the items, but those items were awesome! Totally worth a try to sample and see what you like based on your taste, as for me I'll be back for the brisket and greens!

Xpj_-7LaQ2UIbNgexc6ysQ.text: Very average BBQ.  Sides are not very good, at all: Beans are thick like cement with out-of-the-can flavor Russian Cabbage is WAY too sweet and mushy Mashed Potatoes were pretty good, but not special  Meats All WAY too dry. Brisket had good flavor so the moist parts were very good - but most was way too dry Chicken had decent flavor Tri-Tip might have been OK but it was tough and dry  And it is pretty expensive.  For this kind of scratch Rudy's rules over this place.

_Mo_OvAMQY20XxjCNcZwKw.text: This was my second time eating here 1st time was about a year earlier. I had the Brisket sandwich both times with a side of macaroni salad and cherry pie.  The brisket was very good and I really liked the classic BBQ sauce.  Macaroni salad and pie were also good.  One thing I look forward to at BBQ places is a good sweet tea; however, both times I was disappointed in the tea, tasted terrible like it was tainted, so bad that I couldn't even drink it and poured it out. Not sure if It's their cleaning process or if it's non-filtered water but it was foul both time and a year apart. Tried the unsweetened tea and it was also weird.  I had not come back in so long because of the disappointment in be tea, I was in the area though and remembered that he food was good so figured I would give it another chance. Don't think I will be returning again the tea being bad again. I think they have better food than their competitor Rudy's next door, but Rudy's knows how to do the tea right.

kM65ZlYdMLACbwuucwPwBg.text: You know that amazing aroma you can smell when you get out of your car at Can't Stop?  Well, that bouquet's coming from Rudy's, across the street.  Don't be a fool... go across the street.

NAkssMNlNEfTSSCyd7HPFQ.text: Pretty good barbecue if you prefer the drier type of barbecue, if you like it less dry there is plenty of delicious sauce. Love the garlic potatoes, and the cobblers and pies are the best. Clean environment, staff is friendly and will let you sample beforehand.

wVxgkYGY3k0ZAdWHydS07g.text: Wanted to try a new BBQ place with a friend and we agreed to Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ! We consider ourselves connoisseurs when it comes to food and drink. On first impressions when pulling into our parking space outside of the building I noticed that there wasn't too many cars in the parking lot. When we walked into the building we saw a pie case that was large enough for about twenty plus pies but only had two, scattered out. Wasn't there for the pie, just the BBQ. There was no employees to greet you or to tell you what to do. Again, our first time. We saw some painted feet so we followed those to the counter. Man behind the counter said nothing to us for about two minutes until we approached the counter where all the meats and sides were being held. A couple people behind us showed up and were raving about the place and so on. I'm guessing they enjoy the McRib at McDonald's cause the BBQ sucked. I ordered two pounds of brisket, garlic potatoes and Mac n cheese. First off, the meats were precut, sitting in there juices and looked very dry. I commented that to my friend, we almost left before ordering but I insisted we try it out. I asked for some fresh cuts but was told that my portion was just cut. Highly doubt that cause it was dry as the summer heat in AZ. Also upon tasting the brisket it was pretty much flavorless! Funny because they smoke their meats and should have some Smokey flavor. The sides weren't anything to right home about, greasy ass potatoes that had no garlic flavor and basic macaroni that was probably left over from the day before. The BBQ sauce was straight out of a grocery store brand bottle. Again, nothing special about the meal. I spent/wasted $42 and was extremely disappointed. We should have just stuck with LittleMissBBQ because Scott at LMB knows how to make proper BBQ and all the fixings! Can't Stop Smokin' didn't even smell like they smoked their meats! Go to Rudy's across the street if your in the area and need BBQ or make the trip to LMB!

F9WCVUGKvHbadHg9HoMLmA.text: Very good meat!  Had the brisket and pulled pork. Very good cobbler! Good beer selection,  good coleslaw, good jalapenos bread,  good rolls, good prices.   Great service! Awesome environment and people.    The mac and cheese was a little bland and the mash potatoes were to thick.  The gravey was good though.

ehN79Ute5mr9GQuJ-R2Bvg.text: Very good for the price! Way better than the other place across the street. Lots of selections and great flavor, I recommend highly!

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

XGXk1qaAH2ZtTNlaUeW-rg.text: This is my new go to for BBQ. I ordered the brisket with a side of mac n cheese, jalapeno beans, garlic potatoes and jalapeno cornbread which were all delicious. Also had warm apple cobbler that was scrumptious. Price is good for what you get. Everything was on point and the service was spectacular, I have been to Rudy's and would hands down go to this one.

dyqE1flgT2slOt7BndCV_w.text: I'll be honest and say that the meal as a whole was very nice. Not outstanding in anyway but it was very satisfying.      After delivering a dog for a rescue, a meal at a new place was required.      We were glad to see they were open so early.      The staff is by far the best part of the experience. Nice rustic decor and a clean eating area.      I got the big sampler platter with some extra ribs so I could try both styles. It also included some Brisket, Sausage, and Pulled Pork. I also had the Coleslaw and Jalapeno Beans and Corn Bread.      The Sausage was lean but bland. The Pulled Pork was also rather bland. Even with a dosing of some type of sauce. It was tender.      The Brisket had a nice smoke bark and was very tender, but again rather bland compared to other places. Basically it didn't have much spice on the outside which means that what on the inside doesn't get anything and taste like plain meat.       The ribs were totally different. Very Tender and they had some good flavor. They still could have had some more spice to them. I wouldn't have complained. Both Baby Back and St. Louis styles had a good amount of meat with most of the fat rendered off. Like any good rib.       Both sauces were good though I'd mix them if you want the best flavor. They should do this for you and have a third sauce.       The Slaw was nice but the star of the meal were the Jalapeno Beans. WOW on flavor, texture and likeability. Always get these.       I will say that if I'm in the area , I'll eat here again, but I wouldn't drive out of my way just for a meal.

uLDihcvSFoLoTIN8lk8rDw.text: Visited Mesa location today WOW Great food Finally a bbq place close too home & on grub hub can't beat that, Keep up the BBQ guys it's a winner

DJo83RaqblrP0RulYUHIBw.text: So we've been pretty regular visitors here since Can't Stop Smoking first opened.  I can't say they're better than the place across the street because we've never been in there.  It's like every time we go for bbq why try the other place when we know we're going to love CSS.  Our recommendations: Spicy pulled pork, Carnitas, Baby back ribs, Smoked sausage, and Tri-tip.  The sides are all good too, especially enjoy the carrots and jala-pintos.  The kids crave the Mac&cheese.  Favorite lunch item: Blazing bowl.  Favorite cobbler: peach (but usually sold-out).    We find CSS a good value for family takeout and have catered two events with them with great satisfaction.    This is delicious, stick to your ribs, comfort food.  They have a salad bar too; but like the place across the street I've never tried it.

8s9XyewgTEhkgUtasXzzqg.text: Very friendly staff and really good barbecue. The peach cobbler is to die for! Will definitely be returning next time I'm at Phoenix, Arizona.

GEYHEuNqy5iV9PstbzHigA.text: Went into Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ and tried the BBQ Chicken Sandwich for the express lunch special. The price was very reasonable for $6.99 and also included a side and fountain drink. The proportions are very generous and I look forward to coming back.

LL5IVeoiXyzSNjdsLZ-EtQ.text: I am from out of town .... Went on groupon to find somewhere to eat.... Wow!!! We had the ribs which were tender and very flavorful; the tri tip also tender and full of smoked barbecue taste  and  the chicken fell off the bone......delicious. The sides were good and you had a lot of choices. The picnic barbecue was for a family of four but I think more than a family of four could eat it.... Great deal for the money!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Delicious

8MfaBk2WdYJ-cCUjFRBHZQ.text: Worked with them at a wedding last October in a state park. The food was amazing and plentiful. The staff was gracious and accommodating with less that ideal facilities. There was hardly a scrap left when the night was over.

kjVTLdxqGh7CCOjpO5ywig.text: Bleh! What a disappointment. I saw this place and Rudy's across the street being built at the same time and was excited about having quality bbq nearby. Question: WHY would these owners choose to build across from eachother?! Not smart. Now, in regards to CSS bbq, my experience was all wrong from the start. I walked in with my daughter, who was excited for some good ribs for lunch, we weren't greated. Then I was confused with the cafeteria-style "pick your own food" way. It was confusing, poorly planned and eventually wasn't worth 10% of what was paid. We couldn't even eat it. It was oily, bland and to a hungry stomach=disappointing severely. I wouldn't suggest it and won't even give it a try. Guess I'll try Rudy's next door, it seems more people do, the parking lots always busy.

Bqzogx1ZjFhHwr5m7R5nWQ.text: This is based 100% on staff experience from using a groupon that is described by CSS misleadingly, and NOT on the food. The food is great. I like everything we got except for the fact the potatoes were a little bland.  The groupon was for a picnic pack at 55.94 value, you only pay $32. So 43% savingsBut when you get there, the picnic pack is only $44.50. It's only a $56 value if you ordered everything separately.  Then, despite the fact the groupon says you get one premium meat and one regular meat, we were told that to get a premium meat like tri-tip, ribs, or brisket it would be an additional $4. I didn't call them out at the time, because I thought maybe there was a different groupon option, but there is not and I got shorted.  Not cool guys. Not cool.

etWHAWjOsn1RlAgUctwYew.text: The food was a bit disappointing. Maybe I've been spoiled by all the good eats in my travels,  but I just expected more... something. Brisket, pulled pork, and ribs were OK. I found most of them to have a funny taste- nothing like the smoked meats I'm used to. All were also pretty fatty, and the plate was swimming in grease. The sausage was the highlight of the meal, as was the tasty cobbler. We had fun trying out the three different varieties of sauces. Very good! Last but not least, their drinks are priced to win! No happy hour needed, $2.50 for any beer & $3 any wine. The staff was polite and I really enjoyed the dining area. We'll give it another try.

g1z8fD4aXYn1ZKckZ91cSg.text: We have since moved out of state, but I would give my left arm to eat here again! The smell as you get out of your car...it will make your mouth water. Their hot links, ribs, brisket, oh my. The bbq sauces they have are great. I don't know what it is about their apple pie but it's the best I've ever had. I miss this place too much.

rpzIBxiuMyPW2Cw1V1CoFg.text: Awesome!!!! I was a bit hesitant on this place since I'm out of town n needed to make sure a birthday was remembered.  When I placed the order I hoped kept thinking-- I hope this isn't a scam, i hope my card info won't be stolen, I hope this is safe. Completed the steps necessary & the confirmation was sent to my email saying it would be about an hour for delivery. I'm like oh my, but then I thought - hope they deliver it. Needless to say ---- they delivered the order within 30 minutes and he also received a slice of the cherry pie!!!! Shyt this place is faster than Jimmy John's !! Lol Thank you for helping me surprise the recipient 4 their birthday

92koKevaBto7qMOG8Ty2Sw.text: Yeah so 2 stars sums up this place perfectly, I would say its worth a try for the lunch special, but this had to be the most disgusting restaurant that I can remember, from the bathrooms to soda area and around the whole restaurant, maybe the kitchen is clean? Hopefully guess I will find out, take a pass yelpers, the 2.5 star bbq flavours are not worth it!!!!

_Hj21K-mLZrBI9h7n0DrwA.text: Pretty good BBQ. Lately it's been hard to find good BBQ.  We've tried them all and almost gave up.  Checked out Can't Stop Smokin' tonight.  Not busy...but across the street from Rudy's I didn't expect it to be. Food was great.  Way better than Rudy's. The pulled pork was a bit fatty which probably lenses to its great flavor.  The brisket was amazing...tender and juicy.  Can't say enough about good brisket!! Sides were average. This will be our new go to spot for BBQ.

4iI8Wd9nNExZZXwYf4UHiQ.text: This review is for the "Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ" food truck.  I asked the lady at the order window what she would recommend and she said I should try the pulled pork sandwich. I ordered that with a side of baked beans, a can of iced tea and a bag of baked chips (the lunch special). The pulled pork had excellent tenderness and a nice smoky flavor. Unfortunately, there was no sauce, so I used the baked beans as the sauciness the sandwich was missing. Everything had really good flavor, but $10+ dollars for lunch seems a bit too high for what you get (I'd suggest switching to bottled drinks, I just can't get behind paying $1.50 for a can of soda).

OkcI_mgkGDNWYQ5C3VWu2A.text: Very helpful staff and generous amount of food. Typically for a family of 6 we pay over $100 at famous daves and Rudys. We spent under that and left with so much left overs

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Thanks for making my baby a happy carnivore on her 7th birthday

IvRheRjsCfDZwjyuu7BG4Q.text: First time visiting. Ordered 3 chicken tacos. They are plenty big and good with the sauces you can choose. Would recommend on taco Tuesday $2.00.

kytM3Fbuy-X7xQ2O0ZS10A.text: Thought to try CSSBBQ for father's day dinner.  Out of brisket, small portions, weak salad bar with few choices, corn bread appeared and tasted processed, and only plastic utensils. Although serivce was decent, food and experience wasn't.

klQRNodd2EMajSQaVVaZ6w.text: Love this place too! Great selection. Fast, friendly service. Solid lunchtime value. Well-done to all involved. Looking forward to returning soon.

nFX7mAEUj-hxP1hf1o6bhA.text: Got the dinner takeout package.  Brisket, ribs and sausage were all good.  The apple cobbler was so so.  I went at 4pm so there was no lines and service was friendly.

wdJKviFSM9Djvst71nGJeQ.text: Just came in here tonight and will def be back. I got the baby back ribs combo w Mac n cheese and mashed potatoes and cornbread. Everything was good but I didn't really care for the mashed potatoes. My bf got the pulled pork sandwich, Mac n cheese and garlic potatoes and liked all of it. I liked his pulled pork sandwich also. Would love if they made the creamed corn like Rudys tho instead of on the cob.

rLLcDjUsrTFaGlJ9lUgv0g.text: I love BBQ, and this just didn't do it for me.   Don't get me wrong, the place is clean and the service, while slow seemed friendly enough.   All of the meats and sides are laid out cafeteria sytle over steam tables. We were able to sample a few of the meats (anything without a bone) and to be honest I am glad we tried them out because most were not very good, or fresh for that matter. The brisket was pretty bland and had a weird color to it. My guess would be that it was not fresh. The smoked turkey was dry and bland. The tri tip was tasty, marbled with fat and pretty flavorful. I also had the spare ribs which were tender enough but didn't have a very seasoned dry rub.  Maybe they expect you to drown your food in bbq sauce? I however had the slices of meat with a huge salad from their salad bar.    Way too many BBQ joints out there, tried this one and probably wouldn't go back anytime soon.

L9Wa75iWF6g4_mJXMUxakg.text: The cuts are good. Tit taste like they use a liquid to simulate the taste of True smoked BBQ

QB4Rh_DBEEuP9jAxOq-Drw.text: We had a Rest. com Coupon and decided to try had a hunger for Q.    It was really good. Hostess Sweet and really helpful  Walk through line Pick out Meal  We went for Combo and Pulled Pork Sausage Ribs  All Really Good  Bottled Beer Only $2.50 Miller* Lite Corona  Combo Includes Beverages They have Decent Selection Soda and Ice Teas and Lemonade. We shared a Peach Cobbler Great Portion Served Warm  (Next time Vanilla Ice Cream)  They have other Deals through the week like a ALL You CAN Eat Rib Night My husband Excited About.  We had gone to Rudy's awhile back and the BBQ was good but I hated the Tables and Chairs there. All hard and Not Comfortable.  The Decor here is just OK ....but Seating and Tables Way better.  Thumbs Up for Food and Service. I'll get Pictures Next time.

ZViaEP76tGUv6UOoclQcJQ.text: Meat was so tender. You can taste the smoke and the seasoning does not over power the meat taste. Have eaten many times and have always enjoyed the meal. It is across the street from Rudy's BBQ. If you want good BBQ,  go to Can't Stop Smokin. Much better than Rudy's.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. One unusual table

QmyKPOyzZ9rceI7CGLhPIg.text: I had Can't Stop Smokin' cater a function with about 50 people. They make great bbq.  We ordered the pulled pork, pulled chicken, bbq baked beans, garlic potato wedges and corn on the cob.  The bbq meats have a great deep smoked flavor.  They arrived on time, set up for us, and everyone enjoyed the food and many were jockeying for the leftovers. I would definitely use them again and would go in to the restaurant for dinner and a beer.  Thanks gang for a great feast!

f2g7YvOcUQrG6uOyi_cuIw.text: First time here and it did not disappoint. The staff had some of the best customer service I've ever experienced, the brisket broke apart with such ease and goodness,  sides were awesome and overall one of the best BBQ joints in town. Rudy who?

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. I already devoured half of it and thought I should take a picture before its all gone. SO. GOOD.

H5ckIxeiSLflBpzWwuvlRg.text: Can't stop smoking would be average bbq in any other location. But Rudys is soooo much better that I have no choice but to give it 2 stars..if the owners want to compete they either need to change the recipe or come up with a gimmick!!

iOEE-0QF40F3q7-67ZmzjQ.text: Been coming to Can't Stop Smokin for 3 yrs now! I LOVE this place! The employees are friendly, courteous and aware they're AT work! I like the Barbecue here, MUCH better than across the street and bigger portions! I went to Rudy's 2x and each time the pulled pork was dry, their chicken was dry as well! The atmosphere at Rudy's is like a Cattle Call! Not really fond of that type of atmosphere myself.   So I tried Can't Stop Smokin, across the street! I WASN'T disappointed! Their Brisket, Spare Ribs and Baby Backs are AWESOME! I really enjoy their pulled pork as well! I would say that even though their sausage is good. I think it could be a bit spicier! Don't get me wrong, I LOVE your food, I just think the sausage could be spicier or have a spicier option! I've had better chicken but it's STILL better than Rudy's!   I enjoy the sit down to eat and relax type of atmosphere. The Cattle Call across the street didn't really impress me! I literally felt like I was being herded. The tables WEREN'T kept up with as people would leave. They wouldn't clean where people just left and others sit down at a dirty table! You DON'T see that at Can't Stop Smokin. The ONLY reason they got 4 stars is because I don't give 5 * for hardly anything!  PLUS, the GREATEST thing about Can't Stop Smokin is they also DELIVER.

D0dZA10oSYbd9qQKKUxiDg.text: Saturday night. Mmmmm. Let's pull up Yelp and find a joint to satisfy my BBQ cravings. Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ? Yeah, that sounds delicious. Jump in the car, windows down, good music blasting, yeah I'm ready to go into a food coma. Yum. I can taste it now - succulent brisket, fall-off-the-bone ribs, deliciously-savage sides.   Yes! Pull up to an awesome parking spot and open the car door to the smell of stomach-rumbling BBQ. The restaurant door swings open and wow, it smells even better than outside. Wait in line and grab my huge aluminum tray and say:  "I'll have a pound of the brisket and a pound of ribs please!"  "Sorry sir we're out of brisket and ribs."  ARE. YOU. FREAKING. KIDDING. ME.  Yes, the BBQ place, the place that specializes in BBQ and only that, is out of BBQ. Not only out of BBQ, but out of BBQ at 6:30 PM on a Saturday night. MIND. BLOWING.   If there's one thing I can take away from my experience... they definitely DO STOP SMOKIN' BBQ.

EhR0qt5OCiZh2b3UuNhijw.text: This is probably my favorite bbq joint.  Family owned and provides great food set affordable prices.  Very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bbq Party!
Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

TajjE4WDjUhQdEU3NWV5rA.text: Service was outstanding.  Girls at checkout had great customer service skills!  The two young girls were just amazing. The food was not so great.  Turkey and chicken breast seemed very dry.  Macaroni and cheese tasted strange.  There were also male employees standing right outside the entrance door smoking as I entered.   I thought they could have stood elsewhere.

PyQd8eorPwm4lRbnVwJgbQ.text: The food is only matched by the excellent service, everyone is kind and knowledgable. I enjoy the deli-style setup and find it to be unique for a BBQ restaurant. The jalapeno cornbread is phenomenal and I can't get enough of the warmed spicy BBQ sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Can't Stop Smokin' BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. A view of the deli style setup from my table.

3nP1OOz1IR5lYZNtWxLxrQ.text: I Love this place! Very friendly environment with great service! They have delicious brisket and they are very generous with the side portions :)

eNYTCnP1-00XiSOZxUsxPQ.text: highly marginal most of the food was cold and flavorless. the cornbread was like eating sawdust  however the sauce was pretty good

4rt8rJyVzsVFJ35Ef_-OUQ.text: Wouldn't eat it if I was on Survivor!!!! Absolutely Horrible. Had to walk out the food was so bad. I did not have a yelp profile until I ate here, this place inspired me to tell others not to eat here. Yes!!! It was that horrific

8TUMtH1eoB1rmO87GSrJbA.text: Maybe I just need to try other items, but for now I've experienced better rib and briskets in the past..Your order is ready pretty fast since the meats have been barbecued and smoked for hours in advance.  I thought the rib tips were on the dry side and generally not anywhere as good as what I've had.

66wKsfleWGnTCzdNBTuUTA.text: went here for lunch tried rudys across the street and these guys were def a tad bit better. will def come here again the bbq is to die for! highly recommend

FB9nNkcd7r0aKPuYDO36qQ.text: I recently decided to give Can't Stop Smokin' a try after hearing good things from a co-worker (and the fact that they were running a Groupon special also helped!). I ordered a family meal to go. The girl who took my order over the phone was pleasant, however she didn't seem very knowledgeable and after I gave her my whole order she said "Let me make sure we have everything you ordered....we've been running out of stuff a lot lately!" I feel like that is a really weird thing to tell a customer, but  ok...thanks for checking! I was placed on a short hold and she returned to tell me that YES! they had the 4 things I ordered in stock! Ok, then!  I accidentally pulled into the parking lot of Rudy's barbecue, which is right across the street, and the place was packed! I realized I was in the wrong parking lot and quickly crossed over to Can't Stop Smokin', who's parking lot was completely empty. Bad sign. I entered the restaurant and there was only one other person in there who was placing an order at the meat counter. The man behind the counter seemed bored senseless and was not even attempting to provide any kind of customer service. I stood around for a moment before a girl walked up to a register and asked if she could help me. She was pleasant and quickly went to the back to grab my food. Before she came back, the other customer finished placing his order and his food was brought to the register. The girl subsequently returned with my food but seemed baffled as to why there was someone else's food at the counter. She had to call another worker over to solve the "dilemma" and it took both of them to figure out how to proceed. I was finally able to pay (with my Groupon..if not for the fact that I had already purchased the Groupon, I probably would've just went to Rudy's) and sent on my way. While Can't Stop Smokin' is about 10 minutes from my job, it was a 30 minute drive home. Halfway home I thought "I should probably check to make sure everything I ordered is in this bag!" (my own fault for not checking at the restaurant, I suppose) and I realized one of my sides wasn't there. I didn't feel like going back, and since I paid with a Groupon, I figured "Oh well", but it's a little annoying that I only ordered 4 things and they managed to forget one of them!  All of that being said, the food was pretty good. If I had to recommend a place, I would prefer Joe's Real BBQ or even Famous Dave's over this place, but it wasn't bad food. Had it not been for the quality of the food, I would've only given this place 1 star. But I doubt I'll ever go back...

duN44_ytFbs0WB0EF_F3xg.text: Food is good, if you can handle the manager's child running around and acting like a brat... What's up with an owner allowing a manager to bring a child to work and allowing the child to yell and scream in the restuarant, run behind the counter where food is prepped??? Dragging a broom across the front of the soda cabinet.   I complained to an employee and was advised it was the magager's son, she said it doesn't happen all the time, she said only the past week or so???I won't be going back!!! I pay to eat out for a pleasant dining experience and if I wanted to see a child acting like that I would have went to Chucky Cheese.

T9j6TR66NMdeyq0UD_HcoA.text: This place is pretty decent! Delicious brisket and generous side portions. For someone who's paleo, having the option of having two heaping sides of collard greens rather than being saddled with french fries and potato salad is a welcomed change. The jerky was meh. My fiance totally dug his cobbler, though. When I'm in the area again, I'll definitely make another stop.

4fj6278ffSsxaiadt3a1Dg.text: I went here for lunch with coworkers, and was extremely disappointed.  The staff seemed determined to nickel and dime the customer at every turn, the beef was extremely fatty (about a quarter of the "sandwich" was gristle), and the sides (I got the green beans and carrots) were slathered in some kind of very greasy butter and lard combination

d--w0RBNanc75q6uW5c-9A.text: Got there close to closing, the people were super nice! Got the carnitas, and it was awesome, and the brisket wasn't too bad.. They got punch cards for thw combos too which is awesome. $8 for a whole meal. Definitely coming back!

yXEiBSmfvENhSt_ETpTUAg.text: The brisket is super tender the ribs are good too and the mustard greens caught me off guard how good they could be

1AvcVNge_8YapKkZ9p5o5A.text: Unquestionably, if you want delicious BBQ at a decent price this is the place to visit. Having said that, from the moment you come in to Can't Stop Smoking BBQ you're greeted with a warm welcome from the staff. Furthermore, the food is always excellent and waiting for you, my favorite combo is  # 1 which includes a half chicken with two sides vegetables and a beverage of your choice, at a price of $7.00 without the Jalapeno bread since I'm trying to eat healthier.  Moreover, if you're a repeat costumer make sure to get your discount card, that allows you to get a FREE meal on your 8th visit. Needless to say, we have tried other BBQ's around Phoenix, and for the value and Delicious food this is the one to visit.

I-ArC4vr2JqNNHchXhXIDQ.text: Good overall BBQ place, surprising that there is a chain from NM. They have good lunch and plates deals that makes it cheaper than Rudys next door. Carnitas were good as well as ribs and pulled pork. Its nice to add a desert as well to a plate to make a well rounded meal. Nothing outstanding but good place. I believe it was a village inn before so not too big.  Still think its crazy that they basically opened the same time as Rudys right next door

tbx1_4oF2jFqdrSMNv4cSg.text: We LOVE Can't Stop Smokin'!  My husband is a professional chef and their BBQ runs neck and neck with his!  I always have the brisket because I'm hooked.  He has tried other meats and says they are all delicious.  Their apple cobbler is yummy, too. How people can rate them less than a 4 or unfavorably is beyond me.  We have been going there since it opened and have never been disappointed with anything.  We go there at least twice a month and look forward to it every time.  Their staff recognizes us and makes us feel very welcome. For those who say Rudy's is better, it may be because it's a chain restaurant and more well-known.  People need to give Can't Stop Smokin' a try.  They'll be pleasantly surprised.  We did, and Can't Stop Smokin' has won us as loyal diners.  We spread the word whenever and wherever.

wNG23ANlYMLGdjtLenKZzQ.text: Here's the deal, we have two BBQ places next door to each other, this place and Rudy's. For some reason this place has almost no line, AND has WAY better food, lower prices, and chiller atmosphere. I've been here twice so far and tried the pull pork, tri-tip, beans, and cobler, and all were amazing!! As far as I can tell, its better in every way, but everyone goes to Rudy's instead. I don't understand, but I'm going to keep going to this place, and hope the line stays short.

TKcpx3LLl1ytuKkN8Zr1ww.text: My fiance and I came into to the restaurant with high hopes to find bbq style food to cater our wedding. Scott was very helpful and allowed us to sample the foods. The food was delicious and everything we had hoped for!! I noticed how assertive and friendly Scott and employee's are to everyone that walks in the door. We are very pleased with our decision to do business with them.!!

zJsrVHPKSjNVr2e536WNZQ.text: I would def suggest Rudys next door. As a yelp uses I saw that Rudys had the better reviews so I always have dined there. Love it and never fails. I felt obligated to give this place a try. Other than the more private seating, a very nice staff, it seemed to have more side options and combos......IT JUST WASNT AS GOOD. Quality seemed as if it was frozen food and then heated. Also the sauces arent the best.  Give it a try if there is a wait at rudys

657GPGku5NBEbN1KG70hFw.text: Had the groupon and both tens the food and dessert were amazing! Super friendly staff let us try the meat before and all smiles! I love the mac and cheese and blackberry cobbler! The number 3 combo is the best with two choice of any boneless meat. Will come back as regular customers now!

ssyC_CxexSIE06CZJ3-E8A.text: We recently visited and thought the food was pretty yummy.  We had the brisket and pulled pork.  I also got the pinto beans and green beans. The pulled pork was flavorful and juicy.  The brisket had a pretty good smoke flavor going and was tender, but a little dry.  They need to work on their technique with the brisket. I come from Southern roots and like my pinto's spicy, but not my green beans.That must be a New Mexico thing  But they were both tasty. Hubby got the mustard greens and thought they were good too. For dessert, we had the homemade peach pie - it was heaven!! We were told they are made on the premises and it was delicious.  I am not kidding, the pie is heaven! I didn't mind the cookie sheets for trays and didn't need a menu in line. Unfortunately, Rudy's (had Rudy's in TX and it was okay) opened next door and seems to drawing business away from here (had Rudy's in TX and it was just okay).  I hope Can't Stop Smokin' can hang in there.
